115501.name: The Basic System: Psionics
115501.description:
From Introduction:

Here is a selection of Psionic powers for The Basic System. When creating a character with Psionic powers you must first have Psionic Points (PP). These will help you buy your Psionic powers and level them up. To get these points multiply your WILL MSB times four. Each Psionic power has a starting cost and to increase the level players must pay the base cost per level.

115502.name: The Basic System: Sci-Fi
115502.description:
From Introduction:

The journey into space is one of adventure and dreams. The future that we create can only be molded by what we cannot imagine. Science is the foundation for that dream and that shape.

It’s time to jump into The Basic System’s Sci-Fi rules. This PDF will show players how to create sci-fi characters for TBS. When it comes to character generation you need to consult your Game Master and ask them what type of game they plan to run. GMs will want to create their scenario and options. Do you have alien races? Cybernetics? Starships? Mecha? We’ll try to help you design along the way.

115503.description: The game covers a operational land battle in Burma from January to May 1942. Each turn covers half a month. The map covers Burma and neighboring areas such as China India and Thailand. One player commands Imperial Japanese Army and the other player commands the Allied Forces.
115503.name: Blitzkrieg in Burma

115504.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 18 - Dec 2004)
115504.description:
Cover credited to Excelsior Entertainment

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115505.name: Mark of Hubris: Allies
115505.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a Game Enhancement for the Mark of Hubris adventure.

Who needs companions when you've got friends like these. This free game enhancement briefly explores the use of allies during an adventure. Inside you will find quick rules for running allies and statistics for both Harriet Blackpike, an ally featured in the Mark of Hubris adventure and Besnik Slovene, a possible ally in the second adventure of the series, House of Hubris.

115506.name: Aliens Among Us
115506.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the addition of the D&D 4E PLAYER’S HANDBOOK 2, the game has seen a few new staples to the player character race ensemble. Among these, the racial paragon paths and racial backgrounds have been especially well received. To update the Remarkable Races, we decided to put out our own product sequels. These updates will be released in three expansions, one for each set of Remarkable Races. Included are five racial paragons, one for each race in the set. Each race will also have the option of several suggested character backgrounds. In addition, by popular demand, we have included racial and paragon power cards that can be printed on cardstock.

As an added bonus, there are 10 cardstock miniatures included for use at your game table!

The Remarkable Races expansions will keep your new races alive and well in your campaign. This expansion requires at least one Remarkable Race from set three (Kval, Muse, Numistian, Squole, and Xax). This expansion features brand new art by Eugene Jaworski depicting all of the included races.

115507.description:

115508.description:
User Summary

115510.description:
What is Chemistry: An Atom Building Game?
Students compete to create the largest atom using their knowledge of chemistry in this exciting deck building game. Each player starts out with a hydrogen atom and must answer a question based on chemistry to gain quarks. The quarks are converted into one of three subatomic particles. Players can use various discoveries in chemistry (i.e. Chemistry cards) to enhance their turn to gain more quarks.

The game is designed for chemistry students and it is a fun and nontraditional way to review for tests. So, if you want to be ready for your next chemistry test, play Chemistry: An Atom Building Game.
115510.name: Chemistry: An Atom Building Game

115515.name: Yiarn Caardee Vehicle Catalog
115515.description:
From the back of the book

Over 80 vehicles are detailed in this catalog including ground vehicles, grav vehicles and watercraft from across the technological spectrum. You'll also learn new tips, tricks and design options for creating your own vehicles based on the T20 rules direct from the Yiarn Caardee design team itself! For those who enjoy pushing their vehicles to the limit of their own abilities, included are rules for organising and conducting vehicle races, as well as the licensing requirements and laws concerning the operation of these vehicles.

115517.name: Cup Final (Harris)
115517.description: Cup Final is a soccer board game, played on a 30x50 grid. Each player has 11 footballers on the board, which exert a zone of control which is used to intercept the ball. The ball is moved by means of dice throw which tells you how many squares the ball moves, and the direction type (e.g. diagonally). The board is also divided into 6 zones, and when the ball is moved into a new zone, an Action Card is drawn which may make you lose possession, or allow you to move the ball through ZoCs. Every five minutes the players are allowed to redistribute their footballers around the board.

115518.name: Gute Zeiten, Schlechte Zeiten Quiz
115518.description:
Objective: be the first gaining 6 different chips
- moving/acting by turn -
roll the die, move & draw appropiate question card; if your answer was right ==> get a chip with correspondent colour

question categories (out of TV-series):
love & passion; emotions & jealousy; cheeky & fatal; reality & character; sadness & fate; tricks & deception;
it is not allowed collecting more than 3 chips of same colour

115519.description:
From the back of the Book
It was during World War II that the aircraft truly evolved into a state of the art military weapon, far out-shadowing its not inconsiderable achievements of the previous war. The citizens of every nation were already living in dread of the bomber, and its promise to rain death down upon the cities in which they lived with impunity – that nightmare was now a reality.

From the outset of the war, Germany demonstrated just how lethal aircraft could be when used in conjunction with infantry and armour. Indeed, this was the very cornerstone of Blitzkrieg. However, aircraft evolved into weapon delivery platforms in their own right. For the first time, ship-launched attack aircraft could destroy vessels far beyond the visual range of their parent carrier, as demonstrated first by the Royal Navy at Taranto, then at Pearl Harbour by Japan, and finally by US forces as they hopped across the islands of the Pacific.

Heavy bombers pounded cities and factories throughout the war, but the dreams commanders had of aircraft being able to win wars proved to be mislead. A population bombarded did not automatically result in a breakdown of national morale – quite the opposite. Also, technology evolved to counter bomber attacks, from the dogged defence of the British Isles during the Battle of Britain, to the sophisticated layered defences of Germany against the thousand bomber raids.

On the battlefield, the importance of air superiority became apparent, with the dominant force claiming the skies. Once enemy aircraft had been chased from the battlefield, fighter bombers used cannon, bomb and rocket to annihilate ground forces. Even mighty tanks were fodder for the Stuka, Thunderbolt and Typhoon.

Infantry and armour were still needed to wage war and take ground. The addition of aircraft made their task either a great deal easier or far more difficult, depending on how their pilots fared in the air.

This book contains aircraft from every period of the war, for every military force featured in Battlefield Evolution: World at War. Each aircraft has been painstakingly researched, and includes upgrades throughout the war, and multiple payload options, guaranteeing you will find a use for all the weapons included in your average aircraft kit!
115519.name: Battlefield Evolution: Warbirds of World War II

115520.name: LET's go!
115520.description:
Objective: be the first ending on space 25 (finish line)
- acting/moving by turn -
a 'Trivia' approach with (some) unusual challenges
1. roll the die, move your (question) meeple
2. ending on a coloured space your right neighbour draws a card
3. Colour of the space determines sort of question, symbol if you may look out searching a partner - not your neighbour on the right - for current challenge
4. the faster (with less hints) you find the correct answer the further you (and your partner) may move your (tracking) meeple
terms you are challenged with frequently:
find/name a wanted: person, place, profession, thing, brain-twister...
techniques you may apply are puzzling, drawing, something to puzzle over, yes/no questions ....

remarks:
game was produced by Ravensburger, developed by PwC and Ravensburger

rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
115521.description: Including the adventure part: Sandobars Sechste Reise: Unter Piraten. Also discussion about new german Roleplaysystems.

rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele

115524.name: Over Horizon
115524.description:
Over Horizon is a side-scrolling shoot'em up video game developed by Hot B for the Nintendo Entertainment System, and published by Hot B in 1991.

Over Horizon comprises six stages, each of which concludes with a boss battle. Players can also edit weapons to act differently than their usual selves. In a way, it helped to turn the average gamer into a budding game designer.

Source: Wikipedia, "Over Horizon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115525.name: Aztec, The Three Sun Pyramid Game
115525.description:
From the developer:

Aztec, The Three Sun Pyramid Game is an original board game based on a pyramid, a totem and tribes challenging cruel and powerfull Gods.

Lead your own tribe one goal head : be the best score tribe on the way to the top of the pyramid, and win the right to lead the revolution for their freedom.

Dare you reach the top and face the Gods ?!

A NEW BOARD GAME
By the co-author of Pass The Bomb (Game of the Year 2000 in UK, Gold Ace 1998 in France...)

SIMPLE RULES
- move your tokens on the pyramid
- and gain points forming triangles.
- each turn you play, rotate one of the totem gods to align faces
- and trigger the god fire to push back your opponents

EASY BEGININGS AGAINST COMPUTER
Train against the robot player (3 difficulty levels) for a good rule handling.

ELABORATE YOUR OWN STRATEGY
Find the good strategy for the situation, adapt it to your opponent actions and avoid their traps to be the best tribe at the top of the pyramid !

HOURS OF FRIENDLY TIMES!
Alone or with others up to 6, with your friends or children, play a huge spectrum of fun.

Aztec, The Three Sun Pyramid Boardgame is available for iPad in English and French.

115526.name: Family Gameshow
115526.description:
Good evening and welcome to Family Gameshow! This will be the most fun you can have in front of your TV as you and your friends become contestants on the best Gameshow out there! Come and join me as you play three fantastic Gameshow formats, you can choose to play Control Freak, Hosted by Larry Lightfoot, Brain Strain, Hosted by Professor Plank or Puzzle Addict, Hosted by Tom Wordsworth. Let the show begin!

Features

- 3 Shows in 1 Game
- 1-4 Players
- Each game has 3 difficulties and 10 levels
- Kids Vs Adult Mode
- 3000+ Questions

Source: The Publisher Website.

115527.name: Rock 'n' Ball
115527.description:
Rock 'n' Ball (aka Family Pinball, ファミリーピンボール) is a Family Computer video game that was originally released in 1989.

There are several gameplay options like regular pinball for up to four players, nineball where balls have to be knocked into a Bingo pattern, battle pinball (which operates more like Pong instead of pinball), and "sports pinball" where the pinball game becomes more like a soccer or hockey field.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rock 'n' Ball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115528.name: Action Force
115528.description:
From the instructions:

The enemy, COBRA, have launched a surprise attack on the island of Botsneda. In the panic of the evacuation, classified information has been left behind in the eastern sector. The enemy's grip tightens and an immediate raid must take place to retrieve the vital data. This is a jobfor ACTION FORCE ...

Flint, Lady Jaye and Quick Kick use a modified A.W.E. Striker to cross the hazardous path to the eastern side of the island. You are Snake Eyes, using a custom-built helipack and armed with an automatic rifle. You must defend A.W.E. Striker and clear a safe path. Pontoons must be
utilised to allow A.W.E. Striker to cross canals. The enemy have installed missiles, initiated electric charge generators and built barricades. You must deal with all of these to allow A.W.E. Striker tocomplete the mission successfully.

Gang of Five meet ACTION FORCE! Virgin's crack programming team have created this excellent arcade game featuring superb graphics and compelling game play.


8 levels of increasing difficulty
Smooth-scrolling, fast arcade action
Your Spectrum's capabilities pushed to the limit


The small island of Botsneda, just off the mainland, was heavily populated by civilian and military personnel. A ruthless attack by COBRA, the enemy, meant the evacuation of civilians from the tourist resorts of Botsneda.

The military installation was not so lucky. Despite the latest early warning systems guarding the installation, they only realised they were being attacked after it was too late to retaliate. The only sensible option was to withdraw, which was carried out swiftly. However, the allied forces destroyed much of the installation to prevent it falling into enemy hands. The eastern sector of the installation could not be destroyed during the attack as there wasn't time, and certain classified information may now be in the evil clutches of COBRA! The allies will have many embarrassing questions to answer about just how this was allowed to happen.

Botsneda's closeness to the mainland is of great strategic advantage to the enemy. COBRA cannot be allowed to consolidate their position, nor must they have the time to retrieve and analyse the classified information left behind on the installation. Time is of the essence, but conventional forces cannot be used because their planning and deployment will take time.

The eastern sector of the military installation was a spy base which collected information about COBRA personnel and tactics. The main database is on hard disc attached to the computer. Gun-happy Dreadnoks may well have destroyed it, but the risk cannot be taken. If the enemy studies the intelligence information they will know how to change their tactics and defence systems to defeat the allied forces. Also, the information will take years to replace.

A crack squad is needed to mount an immediate raid to get back the information (if it is still intact) and get out again.

The ACTION FORCE (tm) squad will land on the western sector of the island, cutting straight through enemy defences. A.W.E. Striker and an airborne Snake Eyes, using a custom-built helipack, are to carry out the raid. The All Weather and Environment Striker has four-wheel drive and is capable of speeds of 60 MPH cross country. These give it manoeuvrability, speed and smooth passage over rough terrain.

Fastened to the back of the A.W.E. Striker is a delicate but powerful tapping computer necessary to retrieve the classified information from the hard disc. Modifications to the dashboard are necessary so the front passenger can operate the controls; additional space has been created for an extra passenger. The swivelling roof cannon has been removed to allow for greater speed, so Snake Eyes will have to defend the vehicle from the air. Snake Eyes can pick up canisters of fuel and ammunition from supply towers on the island, although it is wise not to use them until needed.

Crankcase is the natural choice for this mission as he is an expert driver and experienced with A.W.E. Striker [although it said Quick Kick earlier on. JimG]. Intelligence expert Lady Jaye is extremely knowledgeable in the processing and retrieval of intelligence data. She will operate the tapping and message retrieval system from the passenger seat. Flint will also travel in A.W.E. Striker to cover personnel at the computer system.

COBRA, the enemy, have placed many dastardly traps to delay or destroy the ACTION FORCE (tm) team. Rocket silos present a dangerous obstacle to Snake Eyes and concrete barricades prevent the A.W.E. Striker from reaching its destination easily. Other dangers include floating target mines and electric charge generators. All of these will have to be navigated in order to reach the eastern sector of the island. Additionally, pontoon bridges must be lifted and set over canals and areas of water to allow A.W.E. Striker to pass.

Now you have been fully briefed on the mission, ACTION FORCE (tm) is in your hands.

115529.name: Action Force II
115529.description:
From the instructions:

LOOK OUT COBRA, ACTION FORCE ARE BACK!

In the run down slums of the city, COBRA backed terrorists are holding innocent citizens hostage. Action Force have vowed to rescue as many hostages as possile from the clutches of the evil COBRA enemy. Two of their best men have been assigned to the job.

QUICK KICK, superfit and a specialist in unarmed combat, has been given the task of penetrating the terrorist's area in order to free the hostages and rendevous with the helecopter air support.

AIRTIGHT, CBR Specialist (Chemical, Biological and Radiological Warfare) must provide covering fire for QUICK KICK'S assult. As AIRTIGHT you must use your skill and marksmanship to protect your friend as he climbs the buildings and braves the deadly COBRA tanks to reach the hostages.

QUICK KICK starts at the base of a building and climbs to the roof where the hostages are being held. Along the way he will be attacked by various COBRA terrorists. These may appear from doorways, windows or even dustbins. Watch out! All these are deadly and they will attack if they can. You must aim the telescopic sight of your Machine Gun at the terrorists and shoot them before they are able to attack. After sucessfully freeing the first set of hostages, AIRTIGHT has the option of selecting either a Machine Gun, Bazooka or Bio Gun. QUICK KICK then rushes the next level to free more hostages.

If QUICK KICK is hit he will lose one of his lives. As he climbs the building, he will gradually lose energy. By shooting the 'Stars and Stripes' fixes to the walls on some screens, you can replenish his energy. Otherwise he will lose a life when his energy falls to zero.

On every third level, QUICK KICK will have to destroy a COBRA battle tank. The player must build up and keep his rate of fire steady by alternately pressing the left and right keys/joystick control as fast as possible. If QUICK KICK does not score 39 hits on the tank before the time limit expires, the tank will have finished loading its ammunition and will return fire.

At the end of each game you will be given a rating on your performance.

FEATURES * Quick kick * Gunsight * Bazooka * Bio Gun * Machine Gun * Dustbins * Oil Barrels * Crates * Hostages * Gunmen * Baseball Thugs * Dynamite throwers * Plant pots * One ton weights * Bullet holes * Bazooka craters * Explosions * 'First Aid Box' extra lives * Torches * Blue flame explosive torches * Helicopter * Battle tank * Hostage Hut * Hostage Tower * Doorways * Opening windows * Multi levels

videogame: Family Party: 90 Great Games – Party Pack
115530.name: Family Party: 30 Great Games
videogamecompilation: Family Party: 90 Great Games – Party Pack
115530.description:
Fun for kids of all ages, Family Party: 30 Great Games lets up to 4 players participate in wide variety of fun and addictive party games. It features everything from track n’ filed, to playground games, to shooting games. Customized for the Wii Remote, it showcases the variety of gameplay and madcap action possible on the Wii.

Features

Play 30 fun, addictive games optimized for the Wii Remote!

- Track and Field Wii Style! Hurdles and sprints, obstacle courses, high jumping
- Playground Games! Baseball-catching, Soccer footwork skills, jumprope
- Coordination! Balancing, log rolling, plate-spinning, handbells
- Carnival! Bird and animal targets, bow and arrow, laser guns
- Brain games: Mazes, Simons Says, memory games
- Strength: Barrel tossing, rope-climbing, log-sawing

Play with up to 4 Friends!

- Simultaneous and turn-based gameplay for up to 4 players
- Play with friends or against computer-controlled opponents
- Medal system and multiple gameplay modes

Colorful and Playful Style

- Choose from a dozen characters to play
- Unique approach to traditional playground and sports games
- Unlockable levels and characters

Source: The Publisher Website.

115531.name: Der Bocksprung
115531.description:
Objective: get most of all chips out of the bank
- moving by turn -
each player gets a square (numbered 1-6) and a correspondent round (1-6) wooden marker - surplus will be placed on the board as neutral ones;
place your marker on the board into appropiate spaces
roll the die - move your round marker as many spaces foreward by neglecting other ones; take off the very last square marker and put it ahead of the others: now check the new formed patterns: 2 of 3 with same value: gain 1 chip: 3 of 3: gain 2 chips: 3 in an increasing column: gain 4
nothing: pay penalty: 1 chip
game ends if all chips are gone

Remarks: game was produced early 1930's; target group were adults who had to buy into

videogame: Family Party: 90 Great Games – Party Pack
115532.name: Family Party: 30 Great Games – Winter Fun
videogamecompilation: Family Party: 90 Great Games – Party Pack
115532.description:
The greatest value in family entertainment returns for the third time. Family Party: 30 Great Games Winter Fun has 30 brand new games with a winter theme, offering hours of extreme winter sports competition and snow play for up to 4 players. Indulge in winter wonderland surroundings from the comfort of home.

Features

Play 30 thrilling party games with a winter theme! Fun addictive games returns for just $20!

- All time favorite winter sports! Snowboarding, skiing, figure skating, ice hockey, ice climbing, curling, bobsled and biathlon!
- Ultimate polar playground fun! Tubing, snowball rolling, snowball fighting, ice races, and other classic Winter playground games!
- Winter Mini Games! Ice mining, snowplow, animal footprint games to winter constellation games, and more!

Be Rewarded for being the best!

- Challenging tests of speed from speed skating, luge, and snowmobile racing
- Medal-based reward system for friendly competition! Collect gold, silver, and bronze medals for top completion times.
- Choose from a roster of 17 colorful characters including family members, a super hero, and a polar bear!
- Unlockable levels, characters, and costumes

Tournament Party for hours of fun!

- Play solo or in 4-player competitive or Co-Op multiplayer action. Team up with your loved ones and challenge the computer!
- Choose from single game or tournament mode with up to 10 of your favorite games in head-to-head competition.

Source: The Publisher Website.

115534.name: Action Reflex
115534.description:
From the instructions

You'll need lightning reflexes to control the bouncing ball as it speeds round a series of mazes. But it's not as simple as it sounds. The mazes contain many obstacles which have been designedto stretch both your mental and gameplaying skills to the limit. Whether you're soaring over walls or crossing unleapable stretches of water you can't avoid the relentless ticking of the stopwatch.......and don't take ANYTHING for granted!

THE OBJECT OF THE GAME
The object of the game is to complete all skill levels, each of which contain three 25-screen mazes. Each maze must be completed within the time limit. If at any stage the ball is destroyed, a time penalty is imposed, thus reducing your chances of completing the game.

videogame: Family Party: 90 Great Games – Party Pack
115535.name: Family Party: 30 Great Games – Outdoor Fun
videogamecompilation: Family Party: 90 Great Games – Party Pack
115535.description:
The greatest value in family entertainment returns! Family Party: 30 Great Games Outdoor Fun delivers dozens of unique outdoor activities for hours. You thought the first Family Party: 30 Great Games was fun? We are back with MORE! An unbeatable combination of variety and value gives you the chance of becoming a martial arts, track & field, or recess superstar! Are you up for the challenge?

Features

Play 33 Awesome party games featuring outdoor fun! Fun addictive games for only $20!

- Martial Arts Mania! Be a Karate expert!
- Team Sports Minigames! Home run derbies, quarterback skills challenges, and soccer scoring challenges.
- Individual Athletics! New climbing, running, and balance games
- Incredible Variety! Mazes, Martians, and much More!

Play with up to 4 members from friends and family!

- Medal system and multiple gameplay modes
- Proven blend of simultaneous and turn-based games
- Play against human or computer-controlled competition

Play in Wii optimized style!

- All-new unlockable levels and characters
- Over a dozen colorful and iconic characters from whom to choose
- Made exclusively for Wii!

Source: The Publisher Website.

videogame: Family Party: 30 Great Games – Outdoor Fun
Family Party: 30 Great Games – Winter Fun
115536.name: Family Party: 90 Great Games – Party Pack
videogamecompilation: Family Party: 30 Great Games – Outdoor Fun
Family Party: 30 Great Games – Winter Fun
115536.description:
Family Party: 90 Great Games Party Pack™ features a unique variety of summer games, winter sports, arcade games, board games, and more! Winter Fun games also feature cooperative game play, where 4 family members can play together to win medals! At less than 25 cents a game, it’s the ultimate can’t miss holiday gift for the whole family.

Features

90 exciting games for only $19.95 SRP

- Total value and variety. A unique combination of sport, party, and playground games, board games, arcade games and more
- Unlockable costumes, characters, levels for ultimate fun

Fun for the Whole Family

- All 90 games support 1-4 players for party mode
- Rewards including rankings, high scores, and medals


Positioned perfectly for casual family shoppers and holiday gift givers

- Only $19.95 for over 90 games—that’s less than 25 cents per game!
- Three full titles in one

Source: The Publisher Website.

115537.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 63 - May/Jun 1996)
rpgissuearticle: 'Goldene Allianz' zwischen Brabak und Baliiri beschworen
Der Bund von Eber und Wolf
Chababiens Granden bezugen Conte Cedor ihre Trauer
Helme Haffax neuer Fürst von Maraskan
Schwert der Schwerter fürderhin ohne Reichslehen
Seltsame Schiffe im Golf von Perricum
Stern von Grangor gesunken! Erzmarschall vermißt!
115537.description:
Publication date in the game world: Phex 26 Hal / 1019 BF.

See the articles below for its contents. Most pages are used for the events at Arivor in the Old Realm and a duel about the title King of Swords.

115538.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 64 - Jul/Aug 1996)
rpgissuearticle: Brabaker Audienzia bringt 'Goldene Allianz' zu Fall
Kaiser-Menzel-Edition der "Nichtwelt" aus Antimagieschule zu Perricum gestohlen!
Lösegeldforderung für die Comtessa von Honingen
Neutraler Ort für den Gesandtenkongreß gefunden
Was ist mit der Wahl des Zwergenkönigs?
115538.description:
Publication date in the game world: Praios 27 Hal / 1020 BF.

With this issue the flow of time for Aventuria was changed. Any new issue of the Aventurischer Bote now covered a time frame of two months in the game world instead of the four months it did before.
This issue also started the military part of the campaign about the seven marked ones (Die Sieben Gezeichneten).

Included in this issue is also a special edition of the Salamander about the invasion of Tobrien.

For its contents see the list of articles below:

115539.name: Action Service
115539.description:
From an advertisement:

Somewhere in Europe, at a confidential location, lies one of the world's toughest schools: a top secret training centre...
Behind impenetrable barbed wire and patrolled by wardens armed to the teeth, stretches the course, a gruelling track of obstacles, traps and dangers, stretching every commando's abilities to the limit.

Purpose:
Preparing soldiers to join the "Cobra Command", a crack team of commandos who have chosen war as their profession.

Qualifications:
Stength, courage, nerves of steel...

User Summary:

In this game the screen is divided in 3 parts: upper part with some pics that'll change according to the action in the main screen, middle third is a side scrolling view of the action, lower third are controls, score etc.

In this game you operate a soldier who has to make it through the obstacle course: climb walls, evade dogs, dodge rubber bullets etc.

Novelty was a construction set, with which to make your own course. In all, it was received as a game that focuses on the assault course section of the game "Combat School".

115540.name: "Waddle" The Duck Shooting Game
115540.description:
This is a shooting game with a moving target.

Instructions for setting the game up:
Fit the round uprights into the wood bases, highest to the right, shortest to the left, and ensure the slots run inline down the board. Fit the printed housings or "pens" to the uprights. Target to the highest. "Home" to the shortest. The slope or ramp is made in two halves; join these together and fit into the slots in the uprights, but before securing to the highest upright, thread the Duck on the ramp. Move the Duck to its starting pen and the game is then ready for playing.

After that, if you still have energy to play;
Load the repeater gun with an agreed number of rubber bands and take aim at the target to start the duck in motion. When this has been accomplished fire the remaining bands on the gun to knock over the Duck before it reaches the "Home" pen.

Scoring is calculated according to the number of points indicated by the duck's head on the base board when it is pointing downwards,

If a player has some remaining bands on his gun after scoring, the Duck is returned to the starting pen for further play.

115542.name: High Velocity Duelling (Issue 2.05)
115542.description:
User Summary

115544.name: Haunted Past: Realm of Ghosts
115544.description:
Death is not the end. There is a world beyond the veil, another realm between life and death where restless spirits lurk, their business unfinished. Years ago, Emily plummeted from an attic window to her doom. Her house now lies abandoned along with the mystery of her death. You have inherited this dark home only to discover that it's far from empty and through you, Emily has found a way to speak. But there are others who wait in the unquiet shadows ...
Main Game Features


130+ Haunting scenes to navigate
Move between two worlds
What you do in one world affects the other
Solve a 30-year-old mystery
Customizable difficulty to set challenges how you like them

115546.name: PangYa
115546.description:
User Summary

A casual online multiplayer golf game which can be played in family mode (up to 4 players playing hotseat on one computer), versus mode (2 to 4 players on-line with all players watching the action as each person takes each shot) or tournament mode (where up to 30 people can compete on-line for trophies where each player's view of the game is largely focused just on their own round, resulting in a quicker gaming experience).

Players earn in-game money (pang) through good gameplay and shots, which can subsequently be used to buy various items (new clubs, golfballs, or even one-off items to affect a single shot), clothing (which are primarily present to increase player statistics), or even entirely new characters and caddies, each of which again have differing statistics (Power, Control, Accuracy, Spin and Curve).

Free to download and play, players can however opt to pay to buy in-game 'Points' which can then be used to buy items and equipment that cannot be acquired in any other way.

115547.description:
Construct and develop your hotel, from the scratch to highrise superior resort, crowded by happy guests!

115548.description:

115549.description:

The Fool's Errand is a meta-puzzle game with storytelling, visual puzzles and a cryptic treasure map. It is the tale of a wandering Fool who seeks his fortune in the Land of Tarot and braves the enchantments of the High Priestess.

115551.description:
Summary:
Sphlag is a capture-the-flag game for two players.

This is a novel Capture-the-phlag game design for the Shibumi game family.
In this game, 2 players face each other, and try to surround their opponent's flag (or, in this case, "phlag") with their own spherical pawns.
The game uses the 4x4 Shibumi board, with a pre-defined inset of immobile pieces, creating a battleground for rounds of joy with capture-the-phlag.

Rules:
Starting position:
The board starts with four Red spheres, two in opposite corners, and two diagonally to an imagined line between these corners in the center of the board. The two players sit opposite each other. The sphere in front of each player represents their respective flag (or, in this case, "phlag"). The spheres in the middle represent a wall. These four spheres cannot be moved.

Movement rules:
Two players, White and Black, take turns either placing a sphere of their color within their half of the game board (the half facing the player, e.g. anywhere within the triangle B7-G2-G7 for the lower player, and A6-F1-A1 for the upper player), in any level possible, or by moving their sphere up to a total of 4 spaces. No spheres can be initially placed along the diagonal line indicated by the wall (A7-G1), or the opponent’s half, although spheres can be moved into these positions.
A "space" is defined as a space on the grid (not the holes). This means that moving from one hole to the next (for example, E7-C7) involves moving 2 spaces. Player movements may involve movements up or down levels. If a sphere that supports only one other sphere is moved, the top sphere drops down into the vacated hole. If a sphere supports more than one other sphere, it is locked into place.

Other rules:
The last turn's board position cannot be repeated (ko rule). Passing is allowed. If a player cannot make a legal move, the player passes.

Aim:
Players aim to touch their opponent’s flag with as many of their own spheres as possible. There are three legal positions at which an opponent’s flag can be "touched"; E7, F6, G5 for the lower flag, and A3, B2, C1 for the upper flag.

Winning conditions:
Players win instantly upon moving at least two of their spheres into touching contact with the opponent’s flag. Otherwise, the game ends when both players pass sequentially or if both players agree to end the game. The player that has more spheres touching the opponent’s flag after ending the game wins. In case of a draw with respect to the number of spheres touching the opponent’s flag, the player with fewer spheres on the board wins. If both players have identical numbers of spheres touching their opponent’s flag, and equal numbers of spheres in the game, the game ends in a draw.

Examples of legal moves are shown in the files section.

Designed by Lars Rose, 2011.
115551.name: Sphlag

115552.name: Arel Wars
115552.description:
RPG action and defense strategy combine in AREL WARS! Deploy your troops, master their tactics and overrun the enemy’s towers in three grand campaigns. Form the strongest army in the land and fight for your place as champion of Drusilla.

Source: The Developer Website.

115553.name: Zombie Parkour Runner
115553.description:
User Summary

Zombies are running loose and stealing everybody's stuff. In Kara's case, they even went so far as to swipe her cat. Using your parkour skills, catch those responsible and get your things back.

115554.name: Night Reign Campaign Setting
115554.description:
From publisher blurb:

Honor. Agony. Love. Horror.
Once there were heroes.
Once there was light.
But heroes rise and fall.
Betrayal lives forever.
The brightest light casts the deepest shadow, and the fall from grace is a fast one.
Night awakens.
The Betrayer has taken death for his own mantle and rises from the grave, extends his treacherous hand and shrouds the world in endless darkness.
A chorus of mourning rises, A tortured cacophony in the wake of his dreaded footsteps.
Heroes hide within the shadows of the Moon.
Darkness covers the land.
The Night Reign has begun.

This 4th Edition Dungeons and Dragons rules supplement contains the tools a Dungeon Master needs to run a D&D campaign in the Night Reign setting. This book includes six new classes, thirty three new paragon paths, five new epic destinies, and over a hundred new feats; everything you need to experience the world of Falamar. The Night Reign Campaign Setting is intended to be used with the following products: D&D 4E Player's Handbook, D&D 4E Dungeon Master's Guide and the D&D 4E Monster Manual.

115555.name: Earn to Die
115555.description:
Upgrade your car and drive your way through hordes of zombies in order to reach your destination - alive.

Source: The Developer Website.

115556.name: Martial Artist
115556.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first free sneak peek of the Night Reign Campaign Setting focuses on a new class, the Martial Artist. This Ch'i striker focuses on using powerful kata attacks to devastate their opponents. This sneak peek presents the class description, the class features and the first 5 levels of techniques.

Special Note: The information provided in this sneak peek of the Martial Artist is subject to change. The final version of the class will be presented in the Night Reign Campaign Setting.

115557.name: Summoner
115557.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second free sneak peek of the Night Reign Campaign Setting focuses on a new class, the Summoner. This Solar controller focuses on bringing creatures onto the battlefield to help your allies and control your enemies. This sneak peek presents the class description, the class features and the first 5 levels of virtues.

Special Note: The information provided in this sneak peek of the Summoner is subject to change. The final version of the class will be presented in the Night Reign Campaign Setting.

115558.name: High Tide
115558.description:
There's a storm coming!

The tide is high and the race is on to make it home to your family with much needed supplies before the epic storm of all storms hits.
You are low on fuel, but high on skill, you must ride and jump the waves to soar high through the sky and use your fuel wisely to beat the storm and try and make it home safely.

★★ YOUR MISSION ★★
The game play is simple but skilful - jump over the waves and build up momentum to get some serious air time to try and save your much needed fuel for the long journey home. The seas and skies are changing everyday and so does the game. Dynamically generated graphics will make 'High Tide' look and feel different every time you play.

Collect coins to help you top-up your fuel in those scary teeth-clenching situations or collect enough coins to unlock new vehicles with new challenges and unique capabilities.This arcade style action game is all about huge jumps, skilful pickups, sun snaps and beating the storm!

Source: The Developer Website.

115559.name: Sun Pact Warlock
115559.description:
From publisher blurb:

The third free sneak peek of the Night Reign Campaign Setting focuses on an expansion of a Player's Handbook class, the Warlock. The Sun Pact Warlock has made a pact with the servants of the Sun to be his hand of judgement and wrath. With holy fire the warlock seeks out the night to burn it asunder. This sneak peek presents the class description, the class features and the first 10 levels of spells.

Special Note: The information provided in this sneak peek of the Sun Pact Warlock is subject to change. The final version of the class will be presented in the Night Reign Campaign Setting.

115560.name: Circle Dancer
115560.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fourth free sneak peek of the Night Reign Campaign Setting focuses on the circle dancer. A ritual fighter, this striker makes their combat within a deadly circle of power. This sneak peek presents the class description, the class features and the first 5 levels of virtues.

Special Note: The information provided in this sneak peek of the Circle Dancer is subject to change. The final version of the class will be presented in the Night Reign Campaign Setting.

115562.name: Destiny Knight
115562.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fifth free sneak peek of the Night Reign Campaign Setting focuses on a new class, the Destiny Knight. This Solar Defender focuses on mounted combat, marking targets and using the lance. This sneak peek presents the class description, the class features and the first 5 levels of virtues.

Special Note: The information provided in this sneak peek of the Destiny Knight is subject to change. The final version of the class will be presented in the Night Reign Campaign Setting.

115563.name: Judge
115563.description:
From publisher blurb:

The last free sneak peek of the Night Reign Campaign Setting focuses on a new class, the Judge. This Solar Leader helps his allies gain the upper hand in combat by allowing them additional attacks. This sneak peek presents the class description, the class features and the first 5 levels of virtues.

Special Note: The information provided in this sneak peek of the Judge is subject to change. The final version of the class will be presented in the Night Reign Campaign Setting due out in early 2010.

115564.name: Complete Collection
115564.description:
From publisher blurb:

This sneak peek is a complete collection of all the previously released sneak peeks including Sneak Peek IV: Circle Dancer, Sneak Peek V: Destiny Knight, Sneak Peek VI: Judge, Sneak Peek I: Martial Artist, Sneak Peek II: Summoner and Sneak Peek III: Sun Pact Warlock that have been updated based on your feedback. Instead of the first 5 levels given in previous sneak peeks, this exclusive collection provides the first 10 levels of each class.

Special Note: The final version of the class will be presented in the Night Reign Campaign Setting.

115565.name: Sir Reginald Lichlyter's Wine & Spirit Emporium
115565.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sir Reginald Lichlyter's Wine & Spirit Emporium is a fantasy resource providing names and descriptions of various wines, bier, ale, cheeses, and breads. The book is presented as a catelog to merchants, innkeepers, etc. The book also gives plenty of information on the location of Sir Reginald's brewing and distilling business.

If you are a fan of our Tavern Menus product line, this is a must have.

115566.name: Frog Dares
115566.description:
Save the frog kingdom from the enemy bugs.
Collect coins, find secret treasures and survive!

Source: The Developer Website.

115567.name: Successful Experiment
115567.description:
Run great physical experiments with different types of sport balls to reach the goal flag in each contraption of this funny puzzle.

Source: The Developer Website.

115569.description:
publisher blurb

An adventure set in a scary hospital for older editions of Dark Conspiracy.

115570.name: This Just In
115570.description:
publisher blurb

Strange goings-on in the heart of the city's financial district for older editions of Dark Conspiracy.

115571.name: Zub
115571.description:
Zub is a game written for the Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64 and ZX Spectrum which was published in 1986 by Mastertronic and was written by John and Ste Pickford on the ZX Spectrum and Phillip Brian Allsopp on the Commodore 64 with music on all formats composed by David Whittaker.

Zub is in the employ of Emperor Zub of the Zub galactic empire who has been tasked with retrieving the Green Eye of Zub. In order to facilitate this task, Zub has been permitted use of the ancient intergalactic elevator system which permits transport between planets. The elevators do not follow any sort of linear route and must be reached by traversing and riding platforms on planets to reach any of the three elevators at the top of the chain.

The platforms and elevators are guarded by creatures confusingly known as Zubs but each planet has a different sub-species - for example the first level's Zub resembles a gyroscope whilst he fourth level's is a fish. The Zubs can be shot and stunned. They will float to the top platform level and then descend to harass and attack Zub. The Green Eye of Zub was last located on the tenth planet and once the Eye is found, Zub has to return to the first planet to present the Eye of Zub to Emperor Zub.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zub", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115572.name: Venezia & I Veneti: I Cicchetti
115572.description:
Venezia & I Veneti: I Cicchetti (aka, "Venice and the Venetians") is a trivia game for kids to adults. It provides an entertaining journey to discover the characters, culture and sights of Venice. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

Geography & Nature
Art & Culture
History
Food & Wine
Famous People
Venice and The Venetians Today

115579.name: Family Party: Fitness Fun
115579.description:
Family Party: Fitness Fun™ is the ultimate fitness game for kids. Designed for kids to play simultaneously with their parents, Fitness Fun features 30 multiplayer sports, party games, and Wii Balance Board activities. It puts the fun in Fitness!

Features

The ultimate fitness game for kids of only $19.95 SRP

- Total variety. A unique combination of sport, party, and playground activities that put the Fun in Fitness
- 30 unique activities, including trampolines, skydiving, volleyball, basketball, racquetball, and even mental exercises
- Intense timed workout mode lets players create a nonstop exercise series

Multiplayer mode specifically designed for families to play together

- All games available for up to 4 players
- Fitness rewards including rankings, high scores, and medals

Wii Balance Board mode

- Roll giant balls, ride a hoverboard, participate in step workouts, and more in 10 games featuring Wii Balance Board (optional)
- Balance Board multiplayer lets parents motivate kids through simultaneous gameplay

Source: The Publisher Website.

115580.name: Naughty or Nice
115580.description:
From the website

Just in time for the holidays, here's yet another compilation of magical artifacts (both major and minor) that are usable within any Fortune's Fool game. Lost Treasures: Naughty or Nice comes straight from the North Pole to deliver a sack full of jolly gifts!

115581.name: Wrath of the Demon
115581.description:
User Summary

Anthrax, a court wizard, has summoned the Demon in an attempt to kill the king and seize power over all the lands. But one does not simply command the Demon. Instead of obeying, the Demon killed Anthrax and destroyed the once prosperous kingdom.

Months turn into years, and eventually men wandered into the wasteland and a new kingdom arose ruled by another King. All while the Demon continued his sleep, waiting for his powers to restore. Once the Kingdom had risen to as mighty as the previous one, the Demon decided it is time to wreak destruction once again.

A faery foresaw this and warned the King, and he sent his most loyal messenger to find the noblest knight to destroy the Demon. But the Demon was watching, and sent one of his minions to kill the messenger before he was able to deliver the message. A stranger saw this all happening. He found the royal scroll in messenger's hands and took the message back to the King. This is where your quest begins.

The King instructs you to defend the kingdom, and in return he will give you the hand of the princess in marriage. And so you advance, killing Demon's minions as they cross your way, towards the horizon from where dark clouds are spreading through the sky.

115582.name: Pax Romana
115582.description:
From the website

Lost Treasures: Pax Romana is a compilation of magical artifacts (both major and minor) that are usable within any Fortune's Fool game. Feel free to use these as your game dictates to add flavor and fun to your campaign!

115583.name: Chroisen
115583.description:
User Summary

Chroisen is an Epic 2D RPG game, it has a gorgeous fantasy story, you can play as a knight, a magician, an assassin or a slasher.

115584.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Tyranid Enemy Pack, a print-on-demand expansion for Space Hulk: Death Angel - The Card Game, includes two additions for Death Angel: a new deck of enemy cards to replace the standard Genestealer deck, and a new Location card type. The new Tyranid deck contains a variety of enemies to challenge even the most seasoned Space Marines, while the Hive Lord Location cards introduce the Tyranid’s epic and deadly overlords!

Not only is the new enemy deck chocked full of Tyranid baddies, but many of them are Elite Tyranids, equipped with deadly special abilities that trigger at different points within the turn sequence. The unpredictable nature of these enemies makes it even harder to coordinate your strategies, creating tenser moments as you make your way to the final location.

Speaking of final locations, the new Hive Lord cards in the Tyranid Enemy Pack offer an even greater challenge for the bravest combat teams. Rather than facing a deadly location, players will go up against a mighty Tyranid overlord, creating a thrilling boss fight for anyone able to survive long enough to experience it.
115584.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game: Tyranid Enemy Pack

115585.name: Cubes vs. Spheres
115585.description:
"Step into the stylized geometric world of Cubes vs. Spheres, a 3D physics action game where you defend against waves of advancing Cubes by flicking powerful Spheres at them. Use 6 unique Spheres to explode, freeze, squash and confuse the Cubes. Can you survive the Cube apocalypse?"

Source: The Developer Website.

115586.name: Space Bunnies
115586.description:
"Explore the universe like never before in this spacey, tilty adventure!

The Space Bunnies' worlds are deteriorating and there's only one place left to go... the Homeworld. Take off on an exciting adventure to help the Space Bunnies find home but don't forget to pick up their friends along the way!"

Source: The Developer Website.

115587.name: FMIC
115587.description:
""Find Me If you Can", the Enthralling Game in ‘Hidden Objects’. Mother`s birthday eve, a family arrives to a cottage in order to celebrate. However, birthday will come only when the house, which is a mess, will be cleaned up."

Source: The Developer Website.

115588.name: High Velocity Duelling (Issue 2.08)
115588.description:
User Summary

In this issue: News, ADQ, AADA Chapters, Other CW Pages, & Convention Listings.

115589.name: Heavy Gunner 3D
115589.description:
"Heavy Gunner is a graphically stunning, intergalactic shooter game. The game places you in a futuristic time where alien weapon technology is as commonplace as water guns. As alien invaders rain down from above, you man a turret armed to the bone with gatling guns, EMPs, millies and a boat load of weaponry."

Source: The Developer Website.

115590.name: Hive Sweeper
115590.description:
"Play the classic mine sweeper game as you've never played it before!

Hive sweeper offers unlimited number of the classic game set in the unique atmosphere of a hive. Be careful! Crazy graphics, chilling music, wide range of difficulty levels and constantly breakable time record will soon make you a number one addict to Hive Sweeper. Test your brain power, smartness and patience in the 3 types of game style (with different cell shapes), each with 15 difficulty levels. Are you an absolute beginner? Or an expert already? Hive sweeper is the mine sweeper for you!"

Source: The Developer Website.

115591.name: High Velocity Duelling (Issue 2.09)
115591.description:
User Summary

In this issue: News, ADQ, AADA Chapters, Other CW Pages, & Car Wars Sales Renaissance.

115592.name: High Velocity Duelling (Issue 2.10)
115592.description:
User Summary

In this issue: News, ADQ, AADA Chapters, & Other CW Pages.

115593.name: iConquelor
115593.description:
User Summary

iConquelor is a logical puzzle game in which your aim is to control the most territories. The game is played in a 12x9 board.

115594.name: Jelly Invaders
115594.description:
"They are coming! They might be colorful, they might be funny, they might be even tasty! But all they want is to conquer your planet!

It is time to confront the invaders and send them back to the Jelly jars where they belong! Join the resistance, fight against the enemy and become the ultimate Jelly hero! But remember - this minigame is just a foretaste of what's to come! The real fight continues in Jelly Defense where you will lead your forces in a fight requiring both heroism and wisdom!

Now the future of the Jelly Universe is in your hands - don't let down the high hopes of the Jelly creatures!"

Source: The Developer Website.

115595.name: Touch Dance 2
115595.description:
"Touch Dance 2 is a social media dance game experience. Multitouch dancing with groovy effects, bonus multipliers and grading of your skill. Do you enjoy dancing? Then this game is definitely for you!

We believe in you & the idea of user driven content. You are not only a dancer in this game you can also be the choreograph for other dancers.

Integrated server access with over 37 000 smashing dance patterns available! Our users are adding new content constantly."

Source: The Developer Website.

115596.name: Zombies Chopper
115596.description:
"This is a game about an avenger Van Connor who witnessed his mother’s death and his country’s ruin as a child. After he lost his mother and his home, he turned to a life of violence to take on the zombies and to avenge the death of his mother. In a world filled with an onslaught of zombies and little protection, the survival of Van Connor is critical to helping the world recover.

Collect wooden boxes to trigger prolific special skills like blaze, freeze and squall and plow through the horde of starving zombies with these newfound abilities. Watch out for the maces and magmas on your chopping road because they will send you to your doom!"

Source: The Developer Website.

115597.name: High Velocity Duelling (Issue 2.11)
115597.description:
User Summary

In this issue: News, ADQ, AADA Chapters, Other CW Pages, Alternate Limo Design Rules.

115598.name: Fantasy Aquarium World
115598.description:
In this pleasant and relaxing software experience, much like a real aquarium, you can customize your fish tank with different backgrounds, gravel styles, decorations, plant life, and of course, fish. Sit back, relax and interact with the fish. If you have to go away for a while, don't worry; you might even find a brand new fish when you come back! In My Aquarium, Wii owners can choose the fish that will live in their aquarium and what decorations they'll get to enjoy. You can choose the glass color, lighting, background design, style of gravel, rocks, or plant life for the world their fish will inhabit and can mix and match different fish in up to 6 individual aquariums. You can even send aquariums to friends using WiiConnect24 if they also have My Aquarium.

Source: The Developer Website.

115599.name: Far Cry: Vengeance
115599.description:
Far Cry®, the award-winning franchise, makes its debut on Nintendo’s revolutionary Wii™ console.

The game that changed the way first-person shooters are played is set to combine its renowned gameplay with the groundbreaking Wii technology.

Through the eyes of Jack Carver, use the Wii Remote and Nunchuck to drive, shoot, slash, jump, and climb your way through a rebel-infested, tropical hell.

Your mission? Survive.

Key Features

Wii Unleashed – Dig deeper into the power of the Wii Remote and Nunchuck through survival tactics that include driving, shooting, jumping, balancing, climbing, grenading, and Far Cry’s ever-popular Feral attacking.

Weapons – Choose from a variety of weapons in a struggle to endure the rebel-infested jungle. Take down an unsuspecting victim from behind with a machete or meet the fight head-on with your machine gun.

Vehicles – From ATVs to hovercrafts, pickup trucks to Jet Skis, drive over, around, and through vicious combat situations.

Interactive Environments – Utilize the lush, tropical surroundings to your advantage, using stealth to sneak through the foliage past unsuspecting rebels.

Unleash the Wrath – Feel what its like to be the predator, not the prey, as you unleash the beast within. Jump higher, run faster, and slash with more fury than all of your enemies combined through the animalistic feral abilities unique to the Far Cry series.

Multiplayer – Challenge your friends in Far Cry: Vengeance’s frenetic Chaos mode as you battle to be the last person standing.

Source: The Publisher Website.

115600.name: Fast Food Panic
115600.description:
Create the best restaurant in the world by cooking up yummy dishes, making your customers happy, greeting them when they stop by, and keeping your restaurant squeaky clean in this vibrant and fast-paced restaurant simulation game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

115601.name: Ferrari Challenge: Trofeo Pirelli
115601.description:
As the game’s developer, we’re pretty excited about some of the features we added to make Ferrari Challenge like no other racing game ever. So yes, it’s got a whole bunch of insanely fast red (and even other colors) Italian cars. And of course, it replicates the official Ferrari Challenge race experience exactly. And sure, there’s even a famous race driver supervising the in-game handling of these explosive machines (we liked working with Bruno Senna a lot).
But what else is in there? When we started development we were sick of games with sterile, lifeless worlds and drone cars running around, so we came up with some features to liven things up a bit, like A.I. THAT TOTALLY ROCKS, BETTER, WETTER RAIN, THE BEST ONLINE PLAY FOR A DRIVING GAME, SOUND THAT REALLY SOUNDS LIKE A FERRARI and MORE.

Source: The Developer Website.

115602.name: Backyard Basketball
videogamehonor: 2002 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Winner (Computer)
115602.description:
As in other Backyard games, players form a team consisting of Backyard Kids and pro players, which they take through a "Backyard League" season, attempting to become the champions.
The games evoke or supplant childhood memories for its players by recreating the types of sports fields seen in suburban parks and recreational areas.

Source: Wikipedia, "Backyard Basketball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

From the Game Box:

Basketball celebrities include Vince Carter, Tracy McGrady, Yao Ming, Kevin Garnett and Shaquille O'Neal.

Players select a backyard game or season and pick favourite basketball players or backyard kids. Players make shots and play defense, with easy dribbling and can't miss power shots, all set in a children's basketball court.

115603.name: Match Barraze
115603.description:
Soccer Game published by Perma Toys.

The game has plastic players that are set into the game board in depressions. Those depressions attract the soccer ball. The players are spring loaded and when the soccer ball falls into their area you can attempt to pass the ball or score a goal by flicking the player pieces. There is a goalie who can block shots on goal.

115608.name: Paper Trails: Pirates!
115608.description:
50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Find the ultimate treasure in the PIRATES! edition. Each Paper Trails includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Sail forth from your home point seeking buried treasure. Players roll dice to see how far they sail. An bad roll results in damage. Once each player reaches buried treasure, they must dig it up. The first player to reach their home port with all the buried treasure wins the game.

115609.name: Paper Trails: Civil War!
115609.description:
50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Be the hero of the Civil War in the HISTORIC SITES! edition. Includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Both players start at their home base. Each rolls to see how far they can move. A bad roll results in damage. Receive too much damage and that player is out of the game. When a battlefield is reached, players must deliver their supplies. The fist player to deliver supplies to all the battlefields wins.

115610.name: High Velocity Duelling (Issue 2.16)
115610.description:
User Summary

In this issue: News, ADQ, AADA Chapters, Other CW Pages, Interstate '76 Computer Game Review, & Autoduelling Fiction: Taxi Driver (Part One)

115611.name: Paper Trails: Hiking!
115611.description:
50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Be the first to hike to the Trail’s end in the HIKING! edition. Each Paper Trails includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Each player starts from a starting position. Players roll dice to see how far they move. A bad roll results in damage. If a player receives too much damage is out of the game. Once players reach a checkpoint, they must roll dice each turn until their total equals/exceeds that checkpoint's number. The first player to clear all four checkpoints and reach the finish wins the game.

115612.name: Paper Trails: American Revolution!
115612.description:
50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Each player starts from a starting position. Players roll dice to see how far they move. A bad roll results in damage. If a player receives too much damage is out of the game. Once players reach a checkpoint, they must roll dice each turn until their total equals/exceeds that checkpoint's number. The first player to clear all four checkpoints and reach the finish wins the game.

115613.name: Paper Trails: Road Trip!
115613.description:
50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Be the first to the finish line in a race across America in the ROAD TRIP! Edition. Each Paper Trails includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Each player starts from a starting position. Players roll dice to see how far they move. A bad roll results in damage. If a player receives too much damage is out of the game. Once players reach a checkpoint, they must roll dice each turn until their total equals/exceeds that checkpoint's number. The first player to clear all four checkpoints and reach the finish wins the game.

115614.description:
