During adventure mode two characters (one character in the DS version) fight through a level by defeating waves of enemies. The game features on-the-fly character swapping, similar to the Lego Star Wars games, as well as drop-in, drop-out cooperative gameplay, with the AI playing the unused character during single player. Battle mode is a free-for-all fighting mode, similar to the Super Smash Bros series. Players defeat enemies by depleting their health or knocking them out of the arena.

Source: Wikipedia, "Marvel Super Hero Squad (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115847.name: Anima Tactics: Shinobi
115847.description:
Shinobi are elite assassins said to come from the Eastern island of Varja. Ruthlessly trained in ancestral ki techniques, as well as the darkest arts of infiltration and concealment, these shadowy killers dedicate their entire existence to their lords.

Dark Prowler - Lv. 20+

At 4 | Dm 4 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 11 | Re 8 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4

Agent: Shinobi are not unique Characters and you may include 1 for every 150 levels avaliable to a Party of any Faction or Organization. If taken as part of an Organization Party, then Shinobi count toward the number of Agents of that Organization allowed in a Party. For example you could include 1 Shinobi and 1 Azur agent in an Azur Alliance Party of 300 Levels, but not up to 2 Shinobi and up to 2 Azur Agents.

ooo - Ninpo (Ki, Attack)

+ 3 Attack.

Shinobi Skill Card

A Shinobi can possess any combination of the following options, as long the added levels do not take their total level above 40. Any option can't be chosen more than once.

The Shinobi's Speed is increased to 12/16 and they get Open Movement. Lv: +10
The Shinobi recovers one more Action point per turn. Lv: +10
The Agent gets Infiltration and Advanced Deployment. Lv: +5
The Agent gets the Innate Ability Ranged Attack, Distance (8 inch). Lv: +5
The Shinobi gets one of the following Abilities: Lv: +5
oo Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect)
The Shinobi becomes Hidden. Upkeep: o
000 Kagetorii (Subterfuge, Run)
The Shinobi Runs 16 inches. During this move the Shinobi is Intangible.
oo Maboroshi (Subterfuge, Dodge)

+ 4 Defense

The Shinobi gets one of the following Abilities. +5
oo - Korosu (Ki, Attack)

+ 5 Attack/+4 Damage. This Attack can only be used if the Shinobi is Hidden.

ooo Mugen no Ken (Ki, Attack)
The Shinobi makes two consecutive attacks against the same target.
oooo Hakai Shinken (Ki, Charge)

+ 4 Attack.

115848.name: Anima Tactics: Sophia Ilmora
115848.description:
Sophia is the last descendant of the legendary Sage Calandra Ilmora and like her ancestor, she is gifted with one of the most brilliant minds of Gaïa. Bored with her tedious studies, she has decided to wander the world looking for things that awaken her interest.

Neutral Wanderer Prowler - Lv. 35

At 3 | Dm 1 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 9 | Re 11 | Mo 6/10 | AP 3/4

ooo - Organization (Subterfuge, Reactive)
One friendly unit inside Sophia's Control Zone recovers one Action Point.

oo - Offensive Analysis (Subterfuge, Reactive)
One friendly unit inside Sophia's Control Zone obtains +2 to its Attack until the end of the turn. This skill can only be used once per turn on the same character.

oo - Defensive Analysis (Subterfuge, Reactive)
One friendly unit inside Sophia's Control Zone obtains +2 to its Defense until the end of the turn. This skill can only be used once per turn on the same character.

115849.name: Anima Tactics: Takanosuke
115849.description:
Takanosuke is the son of Kage Yagura, the head of the great clan Asakura ninjas.
Childhood friend of princess Kojaku, he has being ordered to bring her back to the main house by any means, but after discovering her fate, he has decided to go along with the princess in her quest to halt the awakening of the Dark Aeon Orochi.
Takanosuke, whose veins flow the blood of a war Kami, has mastered the power of the Void Eye, a fearful power which enable him to absorb all live around him.

Neutral Wanderer Prowler - Lv. 45

At 5 | Dm 3 | Df 9 | Ar 0 | LP: 12 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/4

oo - Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect)
Takanosuke becomes Hidden.
Upkeep: o

oo - Kage (Subterfuge, Dodge, Escape)

+ 1 Defense. If Takanosuke successfully defends the attack, he may automatically escape combat and use Action Points to move as a Reactive Action.

oo - Kage Shuriken (Subterfuge, Ranged Attack)
Distance (12 inches). +2 Attack. If Kage Shuriken causes damage, target unit suffer Lv1 Paralyze. Effect 15. This skill can be used only if Takanosuke is Hidden.

oo - Techu (Subterfuge, Attack)

+ 3 Attack / +3 Damage. This skill can only be used if Takanosuke is Hidden.

ooo - Void Eye (Ki, Effect)
Takanosuke targets an enemy unit within 12 inches. Target unit and all friendly or enemy units with 3 inches from the target suffer Lv1 Slow. Effect 14. Takanosuke may not use Void Eye while engaged in Hand-to-hand combat.
Dificulty: 4+

115850.name: Anima Tactics: Tsubasa Kurokami
115850.description:
Samurai of the Kurokami house, after mastering the Houou combat style he has become one of the best warriors of his land. Now, Tsubasa travels around the world, finding worthy opponents to test his skills.

Neutral Wanderer Warrior - Lv. 55

At 5 | Dm 4 | Df 9 | Ar 1 | LP: 15 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4

ooo - Fenix (Ki, Ranged Attack)
Distance Attack (16 inch).

ooo - Fukkatsu (Ki, Attack)
Special Impact. +2 Attack / +3 Damage. If Fukkatsu causes damage, Tsubasa obtains Heal Lv2.

ooo - Ennetsu Jigoku (Ki, Counter)
Special Counter. If you achieve a successful Dodge, the counter gains +4 Attack / +3 Damage. To use this skill, Tsubasa must sacrifice 2 Life Points.

115851.name: Spielwelt (Issue 39 - Dec 1989)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
115851.description: This issue includes the adventure "Der gefälschte Gildenbrief" for Midgard. Reviews for new adventure books and articles about food and drinking in the Middle Ages.

115852.name: Bataille astrale
115852.description:
Each player has 11 game-pieces:
10 pieces has an arrow that indicates the attack and dark sides of which are defenses. One piece is completely defenseless and without attacking possibility: the Vulnerable.
In his turn player has two possible actions:
- rotation (optional)
- a movement
He may move his game-piece to one of the six directions n moves and if he attacks and there is defensless side of opponent's game piece he captures it.
The first player who captures opponent's Vulnerable wins the game.

115853.name: Quitz
115853.description:
Similar game to Quixo played in 6x6 grid.
Player push the row so that the last game-piece fall over the edge. Object of the game is to get 5 of Your game-pieces in row.

115854.name: Durchs herrliche Märchenland
115854.description:
Objective: be the first passing finish line (field 100) -
learn maths & more about fairy tales
- moving by turns/'Roll & Move' game
each player rolls the die & moves; ending on a marked area ==> follow instructions printed on the board

115855.name: Advance to Mayfair
videogameversion: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release
115855.description:
User Summary

This game works like Monopoly, but is a rather poor implementation: the game doesn't show a game board. Besides that, houses and hotels can't be sold back to the bank. And the user interface also has issues (besides the lack of a board) like when you want to buy houses, in that sub screen your series aren't mentioned, so you'll either have to keep notes, or rely on your memory.

Gameplay only possible for 1 player, against 1 computer opponent.

Game got some bad reviews, but was commercially sold in the UK.

115856.name: Spielwelt (Issue 38 - Sep 1989)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
115856.description: In this issue is the fantasy advneture "Auf der Suche nach Ceorl Irenhed" for Midgard and a short advneture "Auf der Spur des Greifen"

115857.name: While the World Ends  (Revised Edition)
115857.description:
designer blurb

While the World Ends is a story game for three to four players and plays in three to four hours. At the start of every game the players first build a setting together and then follow the lives of the four main characters as they struggle towards their own goals while the world changes around them.

There is a competitive element in the game, and while the characters work towards their goals and dreams, the players fight for the right to shape the game world.

115859.name: Adventure-1 (ZX Spectrum)
115859.description:
User Summary

Adventure consisting of 100 caves, 50 treasures and ghosts, goblins, trolls and a magician all out to get you. Novelty for the game (specially advertised) was that is was a graphic adventure and it had the possibility to save your progress.

Game became part of a series of 4, all published by D.J. Moody and written by Greg Fox

115860.name: Ziel Mars
115860.description:
Objective: be the first bringing all of your 3 spaceships back to Earth
- simple 'Roll & Move' game -
each player gets 3 spaceships;
roll the die and follow the red line to mars unless you end up on a space forcing you to change the route;
you may follow the green line back to earth only if all of your spaceships are landed successfully on mars - same approach compared to outward flight

115861.name: Necromancers
115861.description:
From Introduction:

Necromancers are those who have looked into the Nether regions of the universe and seen a power both great and terrible. The corrupting power of Darkness seeks to replace all Life with its own energies, and anyone willing to give up their own life force to the Darkness can expect to be granted impressive might. Darkness is the force that animates the dead and turns the living into walking mockeries of what we call life, but it does provide a kind of immortality to its most ardent supporters. Necromancers are the most active servants of this shadowy power, seeking to manipulate Darkness to their own ends...and the ends of That Which Corrupts All.

115862.name: Priests
115862.description:
From Introduction:

Priests connect to their Higher Powers in a way no others can, channeling the forces of Light and their faith in a very real and spectacular way. These forces are called "invocations," and they are fully dependent on the Priest's standing in the eyes of that which he serves. Priest invocations generally have visual effects of pure, white light, accompanied by haunting, echoing choral music.

115863.name: 'Cocub' The 'Cococubs' Game
115863.description:
Promotional game published by Cadbury's. It must have been quite expensive to make because it utilised three companies. Cadbury paid for the project. Britains, the world famous maker of toy soldiers, made the playing pieces. And De La Rue printed everything.

The rules;

1. Each player may choose their favourite Cococub playing piece. During the game you should address yourself by his name.
2. Each player starts from Mr. Pie Porker's garden (in the centre of the board). A player throws the die and moves along the track, the number thrown.
3. The blue and black squares are penalties. The yellow squares are rewards.
4. You cannot land on the same square as another Cococub. If that should happen, then you don't move at all for that turn.
5. The first player to get back to Pie Porker's garden, wins. It is necessary to roll the exact number to get back into the garden.
6. The winner should ask mother for a bar of Cadbury's Milk Chocolate.

115865.name: The Adventures of Saint Bernard
videogameversion: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release
115865.description:
User Summary

Arcade game of five levels where you're a St.Bernard dog speeding to your master's rescue. Though famous for snow and ice rescue ops in the Alps, this game also features penguins and walruses. Action involved jumping over walruses in one level, scaring wolves away by turning towards them in another, and so on.

115866.name: Kuskalla
115866.description:
"UNITED" is the goal, a pure strategy game for 2 or 3 people.

It is a game that opens the mind, as they play the games is achieved more quickly display the wide variety of possible moves for each piece.

In a hexagonal board, further divided into "rings", each chip has the potential to move in 14 different ways.

Try to connect the pieces themselves go while seeking to block and separate the adversaries.

It comes in three exciting game modes.

"UNIDOS" es el objetivo, un juego de pura estrategia para 2 o 3 personas.

Es un juego que abre la mente, a medida que se juegan las partidas se logra visualizar más rápidamente la amplia variedad de posibilidades de movimientos para cada pieza.

En un tablero exagonal, dividido además en "anillos", cada una de las fichas tiene el potencial de moverse en 14 sentidos diversos.

Hay que tratar de ir conectando las piezas propias mientras se busca bloquear y separar las adversarias.

Se presenta con tres interesantes modalidades de juego.

115867.name: The Diamond Eye of Korr
115867.description:
From Introduction:

Many years ago, an old, venerable wizard lay dying alone in his small thatch house. Wise and kind, the wizard had made many friends in his life, yet none were at his side in his last hour. The reason for this is not entirely proven to be known, but rumor has it that the elderly mage had posed a quest to those that adored him.

He told them a tale of yet another wizard, this one very dark and evil. Supposedly, this dark wizard owned a large diamond that he referred to as the Eye of Korr. With this diamond, the evil mage could scry into the minds of any he wished, and manipulate his victim’s thoughts.

115868.name: The Mansion on Misty Moor
115868.description:
From Introduction:

While in Burden’s Peak, the PCs are approached by a local cleric of the church of the Raven Queen. He has heard of the PCs exploits, and requests that they lend their courage and abilities as a service to the Raven Queen.
The cleric introduces himself as Beldric, and then tells the PCs a strange story:

Six years ago, a man and his wife had reached the pinnacle of wealth. They had a fantastic mansion built to the northwest of Burden’s Peak, just outside the safety of the large walls, and proclaimed it their retirement home. All was well for several years, and then local girls started to go missing. These girls were mostly homeless or runaways, so little alarm was raised. By the time people began to take notice, more than a dozen girls had vanished.

115869.name: Hasbro Family Game Night
115869.description:
Join your host, Mr. Potato Head, as you and your family play classic Hasbro games, as well as exciting new versions of old favorites created for the Nintendo Wii. Hasbro Family Game Night features family favorites such as Connect Four, Battleship, Yahtzee, Boggle, SORRY! and the all new, SORRY! Sliders.

Features

- Classic Games - Play the classic games that you know and love.
- Play like Never Before - Exciting new ways to play every game – like Connect Four Power Chips, Boggle Portal Cubes, Reverse Yahtzee and Battleship Barrage.
- Deck Out Your Very Own Game Room
Choose the game room theme that’s right for you.
Earn new game themed trophies, furniture and decorations to customize your game room.
- Host a Game Party - Quickly build a custom Party Game by choosing your favorite games, number of players, and time you want to play.

Source: The Publisher Website.

115870.name: The Scourge of Icewind: Part 1
115870.description:
From Introduction:

While traveling through the Spine of the World Mountains, the PCs stumble upon a wrecked caravan of wagons on a lonely road. Of the six covered wagons, none have been spared whatever disaster has befallen them. The bodies of horses and humans lie scattered in the snow, some torn to pieces, their blood frozen in small puddles near their corpses.

While investigating the wreckage, the PCs hear a moaning over the frigid wind. In the back of one of the destroyed wagons is a woman. One of her arms has almost been torn completely off. Ice hangs from her face, and frozen blood is pooling under her ravaged arm. When she sees the PCs, she motions for them to enter the wagon. When the PCs are close enough, the woman tries to sit up, only to collapse onto her back. As she coughs up blood, the PCs realize that her arm was simply the only visible wounds they could see. She tries to talk, but it comes out in a half-whispered, choked voice.

“Ice trolls…took everything. Came out of nowhere. No one left alive. The outpost will die…”

115871.name: The Scourge of Icewind: Part 2
115871.description:
From Introduction:

General Drull of Horizon Reach has asked the PCs to look into the ongoing troubles that seem to be plaguing areas of civilization. He has already paid the PCs a large advance of gold to find answers. General Drull tells the PCs that they could, perhaps, learn something by inquiring of the citizens of Horizon Reach, and
investigating any rumors that might lead to a solution.

115872.name: Heathcliff: The Fast and the Furriest
115872.description:
Alien cat-like creatures have spent an eternity travelling through space, looking for a new place to call home, and have landed just outside Heathcliff's hometown! They abduct Sonja, and demand Heathcliff win a racing challenge to get her back.

Features

• Play several different characters including HeathCliff, friends and enemies.
• 3 different categories of vehicles, 4 different vehicles in each category with different traits and tricks.
• Race head to head against NPCs on a variety of different tracks across the HeathCliff world.

Source: The Publisher Website.

115873.name: The Scourge of Icewind: Part 3
115873.description:
From Introduction:

At the end of Part 2, the PCs had traveled to Glacierdale, the long-abandoned town destroyed in the Spellplague, and discovered an opening to the Underdark. Exploring the deep, they discovered a large nest of drow and cyclops, presumably under the control of mind flayers. On their way out, they were attacked by more mind flayers. Searching the bodies, the PCs discovered a note written in Draconic commanding the mind flayers to destroy the PCs written by some creature known as Krellix. Returning to Horizon Reach, General Drull is told of the events, and he tells the PCs to prepare for the eventual coming of the mysterious Krellix.

115874.name: Heatseeker
115874.description:
Story

Players take on the role of an International Council pilot Mike "Downtown" Hudson, often accompanied by wingman Hank "Divot" Harrison. The game begins with a terrorist attack. The plot follows the International Council's attempt to thwart a dangerous dictator with an advanced nuclear cache named Bae Jung-Tae. Along the way, the player uses their flying and fighting skills to tackle a range enemies in the air, on land and at sea.

Gameplay

Heatseeker is an aerial combat game that pits players against a variety of computer-controlled airborne opponents. Players are equipped with modern military hardware and a choice of weapons. The game offers players access to 17 jets and 37 different weapons.

Missions take place over Korea, the Caribbean and Antarctica. Heatseeker has a display feature called ImpactCam, which allows the player to follow the progress of a missile once it is fired through to impact, from several camera angles. Environments are destructible, and players can blow up bridges, airports, docks, and military bases. The game offers players the choice between first and third person viewpoints.

Source: Wikipedia, "Heatseeker (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115875.name: Hell's Kitchen: The Game
115875.description:
You’ve always dreamt of being on Hell’s Kitchen… Here’s your chance!

Find out what it feels like to be a contestant on Hell’s Kitchen

- Just like the contestants on the TV show, players must master all aspects of cooking: preparation, cooking and service
- Chef Ramsay watches your every move and judges you as you progress – yelling, praising or shutting down the kitchen if your skills don’t meet his expectations

-Learn from the best

- As you progress, you’ll gain access to authentic Gordon Ramsay recipes, including many that are exclusive to game owners. Players on Mac and PC can print or email these recipes to friends.

FOUR exciting ways to play

- In Career Mode, earn your stars to build your way up from a Single Star restaurant to a prestigious Five Star establishment. Then, continue to advance through seven more restaurant ranks. As your Star Rating advances, the recipes become more varied and intricate.
- In Arcade Mode, concentrate your efforts solely on food preparation and cooking. The pressure builds as customers become increasingly more demanding. Can you keep up with the pressure before the time is up? Or will Chef Ramsay lose patience and close the kitchen?
- Team up in Cooperative Multiplayer Mode* with double cooking stations and shared ingredients. Play with a partner to advance through career mode
- Compete head to head in Competitive Multiplayer Mode* to see who earns Chef Ramsay’s praise and who goes home


Wii™ system only


Source: The Game Website.

115876.name: Sukakpak
115876.description:
From donor email:
An Ithaquan scenario by Jason Morningstar, using the methods outlined in Stealing Cthulhu. You can play it with Cthulhu Dark or any Lovecraftian RPG.

115877.name: Kingdoms of Kalamar Fantasy Campaign Setting
115877.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here, creatures of dark evil roam the lands in search of prey, while others rule a terrified populace from the safety of their throne rooms. Meanwhile, elven warriors battle expansionist human kingdoms to protect their forest homes, dwarven slaves plot the overthrow of their human conquerors, and the armies of hobgoblin kingdoms grow increasingly powerful. Ruins of ancient empires lie buried beneath burning desert sands, and their stories told in smoky back rooms attract brave fools eager for excitement and quick wealth. The streets are full of the brave and foolhardy, eager to draw steel and strike for little cause, and war between kingdoms is a constant occurrence. The courts of the nobility also hold mystery and intrigue, provided one can master social pressures greater than the threat of a giant’s club or a dragon’s fang...

This special edition of the Kingdoms of Kalamar fantasy campaign setting is a must have for players and Dungeon Masters of any 4E D&D campaign. Not only does this 501-page PDF work with 4E D&D classes, races, monsters, and more, but it also includes expanded background details, new game mechanics for 4E, and an incredibly detailed full-color atlas! No matter what game system or edition you're using, this book gives you an incredible mine of information and adventure ideas!

BOOK 1: CAMPAIGN SETTING SOURCEBOOK (pages 1-275):

The Introduction covers the basics of the Kingdoms of Kalamar campaign setting and the world of Tellene, along with information on how to use this book, a two-page map of the setting, quick reference page numbers for the 50+ new game mechanics that appear throughout the book, and a brief guide to where the D&D® classes usually appear on Tellene.

Chapter One: Races of Tellene details 28 different subraces (humans, dwarves, elves, gnomes, half-elves, half-hobgoblins, half-orcs, halflings and hobgoblins). This chapter even suggests rules variants for the humanoid subraces! Also included is information on the climate, religions, warfare and technology, road travel, water travel, and cities and towns!

Chapters Two through Seven discuss the setting's six regions (Brandobia, the Kalamaran Empire, the Young Kingdoms, the Wild Lands, Reanaaria Bay, and the great Isle of Svimohzia), along with a full color map of each region, a brief history, a detailed history, descriptions of kingdoms (and theocracies, city-states, principalities, and so on), and their important cities and towns. Each city or town includes details on its population, overview, government, economy, military, temples, mages and sages, underworld, interesting sites, and special notes.

Chapter Eight: Independent Organizations presents several independent groups with influence over the population, including the slave-freeing Brotherhood of the Broken Chain, the oft-greedy Golden Alliance merchant's guild, the evil, power-hungry Secret Network of the Blue Salamander, and several more!

Chapter Nine: Languages details the naming conventions and languages of each major human and humanoid race.

Chapter Ten: The Gods of Tellene includes descriptions of each of the setting's 43 deities, whether good, unaligned, or evil. Each listing includes details on the deity itself (such as racial names, nicknames, spheres of influence, alignment, and symbol) and on the church and clerics (holy symbols, holy days, raiment, friends and allies, enemies, places of worship, advancement within the church hierarchy, and more). This chapter also includes a special Channel Divinity feat for each cleric's faith, designed specially for this edition!

The Appendices A through E cover the celestial bodies, calendar, constellations, the laws of cities, the Kalamaran Imperial Legion, quick-reference charts, NPCs, and a pronunciation guide and glossary!

BOOK 2: KINGDOMS OF KALAMAR ATLAS (pages 276-501):

Done in the useful style of a scholarly real-world atlas with plenty of full color maps, graphs, charts, illustrations and indexing, this section details the essential nature of the Kingdoms of Kalamar fantasy campaign setting. Take one look and you’ll realize that this is a book for the ages. This section includes:

Detailed topographical maps in full color
Maps of coastal currents, seasonal winds, climates, terrain and vegetation definitions
Resource maps depicting each nation’s industrial and wealth concentrations, raw materials, imports and exports, military deployments and dialect languages
Locations of roads and trade routes
Mapped locations of cities, towns and villages, with a convenient index giving the exact coordinates of each

115878.name: Unaussprechlichen  Klutzen
115878.description:
Product Description:
Are you insane?
All you wanted to do was impress the cute redhead from the coffee shop. Several ancient texts later, there’s a mile-high squid striding across the landscape, devastating everything in its path. And you’re pretty sure it just stepped on the redhead.

115879.name: The Abbey
videogameversion: Director's Cut English Windows Downloadable Edition
115879.description:
Leonardo de Toledo, a former adviser to the Emperor, visit an old abbey in a desolate rocky mountain.

His wisdom gives the abbot the opportunity to discover what lies behind the strange death of the brother gatekeeper and certain supernatural events that occurred in the library.

Fray Leonardo will investigate all the clues to clarify what happened. But the moment they arrive everything rush when someone tries to end their lives...

Source: The Developer Website.

115880.name: Mounted Paladin
115880.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 4th Edition D&D product contains a new build for the Paladin class which focuses on Mounted Combat. You will find rules for Celestial Steeds, 30 levels worth of new paladin powers, a new paragon path and an epic destiny in this book.

115881.name: Contract Killer: Zombies
115881.description:
"You have killed more criminals than you can count. Now it’s time to face the apocalypse and blow the crap out of thousands of zombies! From the team that brought you Contract Killer comes CONTRACT KILLER: ZOMBIES. Save the remnants of humanity by infiltrating the zombie-infested city, stocking up on supplies, rescuing civilians and ushering them to safety while slaughtering every zombie in your path!"

Source: The Developer Website.

115882.name: Tous risques
115882.description:
Each turn a player takes the role of entrepreneur, the other players become insurers.
The entrepreneur must negotiate insurance contracts with other players to protect themselves from harm.
5 categories of events, fire, theft, illness, accident, water damage.

Players have cards in their hands that will be part of contract negotiations.

Once all players have toured as a businessman, the richest wins.

115883.name: Defense of Fortune: The Savior
115883.description:
"★ Let's be the savior of the Fortune world.

"Defense of Fortune : The Savior" is Episode 3 of The Fortune Chronicle Series.
"Rebirth of Fortune" and "Sorcerer of Fortune" are in The Fortune Chronicle Series, these games were SRPG and Puzzle.
The Defense of Fortune is a new challenge as a defense style game.

★ The goal of the game

The goal is defending castles with request of every lord of castles in the world.
You have to defeat all of the enemies before tearing the castles down.
Save all of the castles from enemies and upgrade units and facilities with money which gained by defeating enemies.
Ultimately, eliminate the conspiracy of Ancient Dragon which is a mother of evil."

Source: The Developer Website.

115884.name: Pirate's Bay
115884.description:
A game for two buccaneers.
After placing the 12 treasure cards (six vertically - including two face-down cards and six horizontally including 2 face-down cards), each player takes his pack of 18 cards buccaneers.
The players draw cards from their packs and play a in turn on the table.
When all cards are played, they look at who is in the majority for each treasure in each row and column.

Players add up the values ​​of their treasures to know how many points they totaled for that round.

115885.name: Volcano Island
115885.description:
User Summary

Volcano Island is a turn-based strategy game. You have 5 different islands to play with. The island is sinking fast and your goal is to save as many of your poeple as possible, but beware the are many dangers, octopuses, sharks and worst of all some of your people can´t swim.

115887.name: Zoo Zoo Land
115887.description:
Each player takes a set of cards and place before him the map engine. At the same time, players will return the first card in their deck and place it next to the locomotive. The following cards are drawn and then:

1) be placed at the end of the train if the number of animals is greater than the last card of the convoy
2) be placed on a card already in the convoy when the number of animals is less than or equal to the last card of the convoy

When all cards have been drawn, the player with the longest convoy wins. A tie, the one with the largest number of animals visible wins

115888.name: Tankard Tales: Willowbark's
115888.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eat, Drink and Be Merry!
Tankard Tales: Willowbark's describes a unique tavern at the edge of the fantastic wilderlands of adventure. Nestled in a massive willow tree, the inn serves both those seeking their fortune and the ones who have returned, with gold and stories in abundance.

Willowbark's contains the following:

A Dungeons and Dragons 4E Module!
Details of the tavern, from its history and employees, to the evil secrets that are jealously guarded.
Two encounters: one heroic tier and on paragon tier.
TWO 17"x20" full-color battlemaps.
A page of cut-out furniture to make your own interior designs.

115889.name: Tankard Tales: Comeback Inn
115889.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eat, Drink and Be Merry!
Tankard Tales: Comeback Inn is the latest MMP release of a unique tavern at the edge of the fantastic wilderlands of adventure. An ancient temple has been converted to an inn and managed by a retired cleric adventurer. Discover why this inn, more than any other in the area is preferred by adventurers and why everyone has a raucous drinking celebration when someone leaves this mortal coil!

The Comeback Inn contains the following:

A Dungeons and Dragons 4E Accessory!
Details of the tavern, from its history and employees, to the strange traditions the inn has created.
Seven encounters covering the heroic and paragon tiers with a special one designed around Essentials-style play. Fight brownies and boggarts and ancient elder evils. Cross planes to find a hidden artifact and stop an evil orc tribe from gaining cosmic power!
19 monsters using the new stat block layout as well as 2 diseases
TWO HUGE full-color battlemaps.
Layered battlemaps can have dungeon dressing or not, expanding their usefulness
Three pages of cut-out furniture to make your own interior designs.

115890.name: Portugal 1111: A Conquista de Soure
videogameversion: Portugal 1111: A Conquista de Soure PC edition
115890.description:
Portugal 1111: A Conquista de Soure ("Portugal 1111: Soure's Conquest") is a real-time strategy game developed by Ciberbit, a Portuguese multimedia company, in partnership with the Municipality of Soure and historians from the University of Coimbra. The game depicts the historical events of the Portuguese Reconquista, when the Christians fought against Moorish invaders.
It was the first commercial video game completely produced and designed in Portugal.
The game, a historic real-time strategy game similar to Microsoft's Age of Empires, was published by the Portuguese magazine Visão, and was released in 2004.

Source: Wikipedia, "Portugal 1111", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115891.name: Rocks
115891.description: An abstract roll and move game for two players. Each player has eight pawns, divided between two start areas. The goal is to be the first to get one pawn to the center of the board, following the pathways. This is complicated by the twelve polished rocks that start on designated spaces. pawns cannot pass rocks, but by landing a pawn on a rock exactly, a player can relocate the rock to hinder the other players pawns.

115892.name: Spirits of Steam & Sorcery
115892.description:
From Introduction:

These rules began as an adaptation of the Fate 3.0 rules, as seen in Spirit of the Century, to the Castle Falkenstein setting. It eventually evolved into a slightly more generic set of rules for any Steam and Sorcery setting, taking some liberties with the Falkenstein setting in the process and adding elements from Changling :The Lost and other sources. This is version 1.20, and includes an expanded Lore section with sample spells, how to build new Lores, Matter Lore was renamed Transmutation, Cantrips are now a stunt and were replaced by the new Technomancy lore, and Summoning now requires a Stunt (each Lore now has at least 1 stunt). I also added the Troll race.

115893.name: Spirits of Chrome & Cyberspace
115893.description:
From Introduction:

These rules are built on my Spirits of Steam & Sorcery expansion of FATE3, but where SoS&S allowed you to play in a magical steampulp Victorian era, Spirits of Chrome and Cyberspace (hereafter referred to as SoC&C) moves into the near future, to a world where the corps have great control over the world, chromed street samurai run in the shadows, and magic has returned to the world, bringing with it goblinization of a significant percentage of the world’s population, the awakening of dragons and deadly insect spirits, and street mages for sale to anyone with the nu-yen. This is version 1.1, and features an expanded Lore section with sample spells, how to build new Lores, Matter Lore was renamed Transmutation, Cantrips are now a stunt and were replaced by the new Technomancy lore, and Summoning now requires a Stunt (each Lore now has at least 1 stunt).

115894.name: Blood Red Sands Play Aids
115894.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tools and play sheets for Blood Red Sands for use with the Beta playtest rules.

115895.name: Dungeon Without a Master: Mechanical Mayhem
115895.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dungeon Without a Master: Mechanical Mayhem provides a means to run a random dungeon with random encounters without even needing a GM! The Mechanical Mayhem mansion is a dungeon run by an evil wizard who has a passion for creating constructs and other mechanical contraptions. It is populated with mechanical warriors, constructs, biomechanical hybrid creatures and rust monsters come to feast on all the scrap that gets produced. The owner of the dungeon has replaced his body with a mechanical frame in a ritual similar to becoming a lich and spends his days running a factory which produces constructs purely for his amusement. The dungeon is designed for level 8 characters and tips for making a mechanically themed party are included.

This product contains:

An encounter deck for the random encounters;
10 new constructs ranging from level 8 to 11, including minions, elite and solo;
7 fully statted NPCs;
3 new templates, including one that doesn't have to make a monster elite;
A new chamber feature table to add a mechanical theme to each room of the dungeon.




Whether you want to play in a game instead of always being the GM, want a fun way to spend an evening destroying robots, or want to add some new constructs to your game, this product is sure to deliver some Mechanical Mayhem!

115896.name: High School Musical 3: Senior Year Dance!
115896.description:
Get ready to dance!

High School Musical 3: Senior Year DANCE lets you experience the energy, the fun, and the music from all three High School Musical movies. Dance to the beat of ""High School Musical"" songs, explore movie locations and play alongside familiar High School Musical characters. Plus new music from High School Musical 3: Senior Year will keep the Wildcat fun moving!

-Dance to favorite ""High School Musical"" songs from all 3 films

-Play as familiar characters including Troy, Gabriella, Sharpay, Ryan, Chad, and Taylor, or create and customize their own unique Wildcat

-Play with friends - compete in dance-offs or dance as a duo

-Includes bonus footage from High School Musical 3: Senior Year"

Source: The Publisher Website.

115897.name: Slumbering Tsar: The Hidden Citadel, Part 4: In the Belly of the Beast
115897.description:
From the publisher's website:

The belly of the beast, the heart of the evil, the pits of despair, these and many other names are given for the dangers that the PCs face as they explore the Inner Temple, the Upper Cloisters, and the dread Mausoleum high in the upper fanes of the Hidden Citadel—heights where the few who enter find that they have come too far to turn back.

115901.name: The Witch Player Class
115901.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever thought that there is an important fantasy character missing from your games?
Have you ever wanted a darker alternative to the wizard?
Do you want a new take on the leader role?
If so, The Witch is the class you need!

The witch has learned the secrets of arcane magic, not through careful study and tutelage like the Wizard, but through uncontrolled experimentation and creative use of the magical forces around her. On the battlefield, she uses a lot of spells that manipulate her foes to give her allies the upper hand and some that guide her party to victory. She induces fear in her enemies and uses her mystical power for healing. She warps the enemies' bodies and pollutes their minds. She may not be the deadliest force by herself, but once she has had her way with a foe, it could be crushed by anyone.

This 18 page color product contains everything you expect from a player class: a choice of class feature, at least 4 powers of each level, 3 paragon paths, 10 feats, 3 magic items, and even details on how to make NPC witches. It also introduces curse spells: daily powers that inflict the enemy with curses that don't end with an encounter. Bewitch your GM or your players with The Witch Player Class by Svalin Games!

115902.name: The Basics
115902.description:
User summary:

An IP-free version of Chapter Two, "The Basics," from The Dresden Files Roleplaying Game, Volume 1: Your Story, made freely available on the faterpg.com website.

115903.name: Aspects
115903.description:
User summary:

An IP-free version of Chapter Seven, "Aspects," from The Dresden Files Roleplaying Game, Volume 1: Your Story, made freely available on the faterpg.com website.

From Introduction:

What Are Aspects?

The central character attributes in FATE are called aspects. Aspects cover a wide range of elements and define what makes your character unique—basically, they describe the core of your character's identity. (By contrast, skills and stunts could be said to paint a similar picture of what your character can do, rather than who he is.)

Aspects can be:

Relationships (Mama's Boy, Chosen of the Dread Lord)
Beliefs (The Lord Is My Shepherd, Nothing Is Forever)
Catchphrases (Can't Keep My Mouth Shut, "It's Not My Fault!")
Descriptors (Wiseass Wizard, Rugged as the Road)
Items (My Vorpal Sword Goes Snicker-Snack, My Lucky Rabbit's Foot)
Pretty much anything else that paints a vivid picture of the character (Big Man On Campus, Anger Is My Constant Companion)




In terms of game rules, aspects are the main avenue by which you gain or spend fate points for your character. Fate points are a kind of currency that can be spent for bonuses, and they are earned when aspects cause problems and complications for the character.

115904.name: Advancement
115904.description:
User summary:

An IP-free version of Chapter Six, "Advancement," from The Dresden Files Roleplaying Game, Volume 1: Your Story, made freely available on the faterpg.com website.

From Introduction:

Change Happens

Characters are not static objects—they grow and develop over time, evolving in response to the conflicts they face during the game and the choices they make. Settings are similar—but they grow and develop in response to the successes and failures of the various characters. The rate at which both characters and settings grow and change is measured in milestones.

Milestones & Characters

Milestones are moments in the game where something has happened to justify some kind of advancement. Milestones largely occur according to the GM's discretion, and the frequency of their occurrence will do a lot to establish the overall tone and feel of a campaign—frequent milestones allow the characters to grow rapidly and give a sort of "epic" feel to the campaign as the opposition scales in response; infrequent milestones make things feel more grounded and established.

Milestones fall into three categories—minor, significant, and major. There are some guidelines for when each happens, along with what characters can do during each type of milestone.

115905.name: The Living City
115905.description:
User summary:

An IP-free version of Chapter Three, "City Creation," from The Dresden Files Roleplaying Game, Volume 1: Your Story, made freely available on the faterpg.com website.

From Introduction:

When you sit down to play, you'll want to know the setting—which is to say, you'll want to come up with and flesh out the city in which your game takes place. Since it mostly takes place in today's urban jungles, this doesn't have to take a long time, as you're already pretty familiar with the way our world works.

(For crazy stuff like games taking place in the supernatural world or the like, read on—we've got you covered, too. We have a loose definition of "city.")

There's a lot of stuff in this chapter. Our purpose is to give you lots of ideas and options. If you don't really want to immerse yourself in the process we lay out here, it's no big deal. While we still encourage you to read through the chapter so you see what we're going for, toward the tail end we provide an on-the-fly city creation technique that highlights the really critical parts, letting you get to the gaming faster. (If you do the full city creation process a few times, your own process will probably move toward that anyway as you learn which parts are the most useful for your group.) You should feel free to pick and choose the parts that look fun as you go along.

A city is much more than just a collection of streets and buildings—it's a world filled with people, including the players' characters and all the characters they might encounter. Creating your city includes mapping out both some of the physical locations and the relationships the people who live and work there have with the places and with each other. Once you're done with city creation, you should be ready to sit down and play.

115906.name: Stunts
115906.description:
User summary:

An IP-free version of Chapter Nine, "Mortal Stunts," from The Dresden Files Roleplaying Game, Volume 1: Your Story, made freely available on the faterpg.com website.

From Introduction:

What Are Stunts?

Just enumerating a person's skills doesn't quite give you the full picture of what he's capable of. Most people have little tricks, advantages, or knacks that they pull out when they need a bit of something extra. We call these little knacks stunts.

What Stunts Do

Stunts exist to provide guaranteed situational benefits. These benefits might be the result of special training, unique (but non-supernatural) abilities, or something that's just innately cool about your character. A stunt may grant a character the ability to use a skill under unusual circumstances, using it in a broader array of situations than normal, substituting it for another skill, or using it in a complementary fashion to another skill. A stunt might allow a character to gain an effect roughly equal to two shifts used in a specific way or to otherwise grant other small effects. Put more simply, stunts allow the usual rules about skills to be bent—or even broken. We'll get into how to build your own stunts shortly.

Some stunts may have prerequisites (other stunts or even aspects). Particularly potent stunts may also require the use of a fate point to be activated. In general, a character should not take a stunt tied to a skill he does not have at least at Average level.

115907.name: Character Creation
115907.description:
User summary:

An IP-free version of Chapter Four, "Character Creation," from The Dresden Files Roleplaying Game, Volume 1: Your Story, made freely available on the faterpg.com website.

From Introduction:


Character Creation Is Play

Many roleplaying games propose a simple idea: you create characters, then you begin play. We think it’s even simpler than that. We say, “As you create the characters and the world they inhabit, you have begun play.” The style of character creation we present here does three things to reinforce that.

First, character creation tells part of the characters’ stories, just like any other game session does. Characters that really come alive have histories of their own and with each other—character creation establishes where they’ve been, what they’ve done, and why they continue to act together against the threats they face. It’s like there’s a game that’s been going on that you’re now stepping into—it’s just that the most interesting parts haven’t happened yet.

Second, it sets the stage for the next part of the story. Each arc of a roleplaying game sets up the next, so that they flow into one another in a natural evolution of the story. Character creation needs to set up the first story arc the same way any other phase of play does.

Third, character creation in FATE is highly collaborative. As with city creation, character creation is best done as a group activity. Doing all of this together will build a stronger foundation for your characters and your game. The character creation process includes a number of built-in ways to establish connections between the characters and the setting. Combined with city creation, character creation can take a full session to do—this provides a good opportunity to lay out the basics of the setting and allows everyone to learn about it and about each others’ characters. This sort of collaborative story building is, in a word, play.

During character creation, you and the other members of your group will talk about your characters, make suggestions to each other, discuss how to make your characters connect, and even establish some of the campaign background. You’ll want to keep good notes on this process.

You’ll start by determining your character’s high concept and trouble. Then you’ll build your character’s back-story, a process that takes place over five phases. Each phase outlines events in your character’s life, though not necessarily in chronological order. The first phase sets up the character’s general background, concept, and early history. The second covers the events that pull the character into the the setting of the specific game your group is playing. The last three phases delve into your character’s past adventures—both his own and those of the other players’ characters.

115908.name: Dargrim Four-Fingers
115908.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a fully developed D&D 4E gaming aid designed as a sample of our writing and design style. We plan to bring products that center around role play elements to you for your 4E gaming.

Dargrim is designed as a mentor NPC for players up to about 18th level. However he can be used as an information source or just a powerful NPC the players meet. His background is written so that he can be a gritty street fighter or a noble dwarf trying to regain his clan honor who has fallen into contact with the thieves guild through no plans of his own. Whatever is best for your campaign theme.

The enccounters are designed for levels 6 to 9. This product includes a full color, full page portrait of Dargrim, 7 grandmaster training skills players can learn, 2 introduction encounters, 5 new creatures, 4 scaled encounter maps, and a city map of Worlun if you don't have your own city to place Dargrim within.

115910.name: Mistborn Adventure Game
115910.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rally Your Crew

Based on the best-selling novels by Brandon Sanderson and powered by an all new story-driven rules system, the Mistborn Adventure Game lets you explore, command, or liberate the oppressed world of Scadrial, battle the Lord Ruler's Inquisitors, and master the primal forces of Allomancy, Feruchemy, and Hemalurgy. It features new official fiction from Brandon Sanderson and loads of never-before-seen material, making it the ultimate resource for fans of the novels and those who want to experience the Final Empire firsthand.

The Digital Edition of the Mistborn Adventure Game includes all content from the Softcover Retail Edition, as well as an exclusive novella, A House of Ashes, written by some of the hottest talent in gaming.

There's Always Another Secret
The Mistborn Adventure Game is just the beginning. Crafty Games will explore and expand many facets of Scadrial with a full line of digital and print releases: learn more than ever before about the tyrannical Steel Ministry, the relentless Inquisitors, the mysterious Kandra, the mistwraiths, the Terris, the Burnlands, and soon...

115911.name: The Crystal Unicorn
115911.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The holidays are a time of giving, so please enjoy The Crystal Unicorn, a free adventure for Faery's Tale Deluxe. Authors Kevin L. Anderson and Cerys Rose Anderson put this adventure together on their own initiative and they've done a great job. They shared The Crystal Unicorn with us and now we're happy to share it with you. Thanks to Kevin and Cerys, and also to Patrick Sweeney of Firefly Games for making this holiday treat possible. Enjoy!

115912.description:
As a present to all of their fans, WizKids offered these three Print and Play Creature cards to add some of the holiday "spirit" to your Quarriors!

The three Quarriors! X-Mas Promo Cards cards are:

GHOST OF X-MAS PAST » When Ghost of X-Mas is destroyed, name a die and draw one die from your bag. If you draw the die you named, add it to your Active Pool. If not, either give the die to the player on your left (add it to their Used Pile or add the die to your own Used Pile (your choice). Merry X-mas!
GHOST OF X-MAS PRESENT » When Ghost of X-Mas scores, name a die and draw one die from your bag. If you draw the die you named, add it to your Active Pool. If not, either give the die to the player on your left (add it to their Used Pile or add the die to your own Used Pile (your choice). Merry X-mas!
GHOST OF X-MAS FUTURE » When Ghost of X-Mas is summoned, name a die and draw one die from your bag. If you draw the die you named, add it to your Active Pool. If not, either give the die to the player on your left (add it to their Used Pile or add the die to your own Used Pile (your choice). Merry X-mas!
115912.name: Quarriors! X-Mas Promo Cards

115918.name: Horse Life Adventures
115918.description:
After three years on your grandfather's farm, you've been given a horse of your own as a reward for all your hard work. Your horse needs to be fed, groomed, trained, and most importantly, loved.

Take lessons in Dressage, Cross Country, and Show Jumping at the Training Center, then put your skills to the test in challenging competitions. Use your winnings to buy new clothes, riding gear, and food and treats for your horse.

Take long rides through beautiful scenery with your new companion, then stop to take pictures with your cellphone. Send text messages with your photos to your friends using WiiConnect24™!

Key Features

- Design your dream horse: choose his breed, color, markings, and name.
- Ride through forests and across beaches and beautiful fields.
- Train and compete in Dressage, Cross Country, and Show Jumping.
- Buy new clothes, new riding gear, and new horse care items in the shops.
- Take pictures and send picture and text messages using the in-game cellphone and WiiConnect24™

Source: The Publisher Website.

115919.name: Horse Life Adventures
115919.description:
After three years on your grandfather's farm, you've been given a horse of your own as a reward for all your hard work. Your horse needs to be fed, groomed, trained, and most importantly, loved.

Take lessons in Dressage, Cross Country, and Show Jumping at the Training Center, then put your skills to the test in challenging competitions. Use your winnings to buy new clothes, riding gear, and food and treats for your horse.

Take long rides through beautiful scenery with your new companion, then stop to take pictures with your cellphone. Send text messages with your photos to your friends using WiiConnect24™!

Key Features

- Ride through forests and across beaches and beautiful fields.
- Train and compete in Dressage, Cross Country, and Show Jumping.
- Buy new clothes, new riding gear, and new horse care items in the shops.
- Take pictures and send picture and text messages using the in-game cellphone and WiiConnect24™

Source: The Publisher Website.

115920.name: Hot Wheels: Battle Force 5
115920.description:
Based on the hit animated series, your mission is simple - use your battle-ready vehicle to defend the earth from the evil forces of the Vandals™ and the Sark™! Race, smash, Bash, and battle your way to victory.  The fate of our planet hangs in the balance!
 
EVERYTHING BOYS WANT!
•     Battle-ready vehicles
•     Ultra-fast drivers
•     Evil predators and sinister machines
•     Play as good or bad guy (Wii™ only)
 
MORE THAN A RACING GAME!
•     Melee weapons
•     Extreme moves and stunts
•     Power upgrades & unlocks
•     Shields, cammo and more
 
AUTHENTIC INTERACTIVE EXPERIENCE!
•     Locations & settings from show
•     Unique battle & racing zones
 
MUTLIPLAYER ON WiiTM
•     Combat racing
•     2-player split-screen
•     2-4 player turn based

Source: The Publisher Website.

115921.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 1 No 3 - May 2048)
rpgissuearticle: AADA ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE
115921.description:
User Summary

THE GUNNERY CHAIR, AADA NEWS, AADA ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE, AUTODUELIST'S TOOL KIT, THE ARENA MANAGER'S OFFICE, THE ARENA MANAGER'S OFFICE, ARENA WATCH, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, FORMULA DE NEWS, HEAVY METAL, HIGH VELOCITY DUELING (HVD), NEWSWATCH, NORTH AMERICAN NEWS SERVICE (NANS), VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW (VADR), WEB SITE WATCH, VEHICLE DESIGN COMPETITION, AUTODUEL QUESTION AND ANSWER (ADQ&A), & CWIN CLASSIFIEDS.

115922.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 1 No 4 - June 2048)
rpgissuearticle: AADA ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE
115922.description:
User Summary

THE GUNNERY CHAIR, AADA NEWS, AADA ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE, ARENA MANAGER'S OFFICE, ARENA WATCH, AUTODUELIST'S TOOL KIT, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, DEATH RACING ASSOCIATION OF WASHINGTON (DRAW), FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, THE FIRING RANGE, FORMULA DE NEWS, HIGH VELOCITY DUELING (HVD), NEWSWATCH, NORTH AMERICAN NEWS SERVICE (NANS), SEATTLE WASHINGTON AUTODUEL TEAM (SWAT), VEHICLE DESIGN COMPETITION, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW (VADR), WEB SITE WATCH, & CWIN CLASSIFIEDS.

rpgissuearticle: AADA ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE
DEATH RACING ASSOCIATION OF WASHINGTON STATE (DRAW)
115923.description:
User Summary

THE GUNNERY CHAIR, 2047-2048 AADA WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP EVENTS, AADA NEWS, THE ARENA MANAGER'S OFFICE, ARENA WATCH, AADA ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, DEATH RACING ASSOCIATION OF WASHINGTON STATE (DRAW), FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, FORMULA DE NEWS, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HIGH VELOCITY DUELING (HVD), NORTH AMERICAN NEWS SERVICE (NANS), VEHICLE DESIGN COMPETITION RESULTS, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW (VADR), WEB SITE WATCH, & CWIN CLASSIFIEDS.

115924.name: Soccer
115924.description:
British edition. The board has little indentations, into which the ball might roll. When it settles into the indentation in front of one of your players, you can bend him a little and let go. The ball will now be 'kicked', hopefully to one of your other players.

Most goals wins.

115925.name: In The Aviary
boardgameversion: H P Gibson african animals edition
115925.description:
"How many birds can you discover".

Party game. Each guest or team is given list of 14 different cards (which are placed around the room). Each card has a little rhyme that is a cryptic clue to the name of a bird.

First player or team to get all 14 right, wins.

115926.name: "Derby Winner" Race Game and Roulette
115926.description:
A game purely about gambling.

There are 8 previous English Derby winners and players are invited to place a bet or bets. The wheel is something like a Roulette wheel but features only the names of the horses. Once bets are placed, spin the wheel, and collect your profit if you are lucky. The role of Bookie should be passed on until everyone has had a turn of being the Bookie.

The Eight Derby winners featured in the game;
Blue Peter (1939)
Dante (1945)
Airborne (1946)
Pearl Diver (1947)
My Love (1948)
Nimbus (1949)
Galcador (1950)
Arctic Prince (1951)

115927.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 1 No 6 - August 2048)
rpgissuearticle: DEATH RACING ASSOCIATION OF WASHINGTON STATE (DRAW)
115927.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, 2047-2048 AADA WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS, AADA NEWS, ARENA WATCH, AUTODUELING FICTION (TAXI DRIVER PART III), THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, DEATH RACING ASSOCIATION OF WASHINGTON STATE (DRAW), FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, FORMULA DE NEWS, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, HIGH VELOCITY DUELING (HVD), NORTH AMERICAN NEWS SERVICE (NANS), WEB SITE WATCH, & CWIN CLASSIFIEDS.

115928.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 1 No 7 - September 2048)
rpgissuearticle: AMERICAN AUTODUEL ASSOCIATION ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE (AADA RASG)
115928.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, 2047-2048 AADA WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS, AADA NEWS, THE ARENA MANAGER'S OFFICE, ARENA WATCH, AUTODUELING FICTION, AMERICAN AUTODUEL ASSOCIATION ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE (AADA RASG), THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, DEATH RACING ASSOCIATION OF WASHINGTON (DRAW), FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, FORMULA DE NEWS, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HIGH VELOCITY DUELING (HVD), NORTH AMERICAN NEWS SERVICE (NANS), PAINTED TARGET, SEATTLE WASHINGTON AUTODUELING TEAM (SWAT), VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW (VADR), WEB SITE WATCH, CWIN CLASSIFIEDS, & ADDENDA.

115929.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 1 No 8 - October 2048)
rpgissuearticle: AADA ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE (AADA RASG)
115929.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, ARENA WATCH, AADA ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE (AADA RASG), AUTODUELING FICTION, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, DEATH RACING ASSOCIATION OF WASHINGTON (DRAW), FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, THE FIRING RANGE, FORMULA DE NEWS, HEAVY METAL, NEW OMAHA VEHICULAR ASSOCIATION (NOVA), NORTH AMERICAN NEWS SERVICE (NANS), SEATTLE WASHINGTON AUTODUELING TEAM (SWAT), VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW (VADR), WEB SITE WATCH, & CWIN CLASSIFIEDS.

115930.name: Mr. Turnip's Aerial Rings
115930.description:
Hoopla version, where you try to land your rings on parts od Mr. Turnip's body. On the board that the Mr. Turnip figure sits, there are also scoring areas, four with a positive score, two with a negative score.

Mr. Turnip was created by puppeteer Joy Laurey (credited in the top left corner of the box lid), for the children's programme, Whirligig. The show was a Saturday, fortnightly, BBC TV children's programme, broadcast at 5pm. It ran from November 1950 to 1956. It was the first TV variety show specifically for children and was broadcast live from the studios in Lime Grove. Not many people owned TV sets in those early years, but those that did usually opened their homes to others, especially when children's programmes featured. Virtually the whole country watched this one and only TV channel.

115931.name: Roadwise
115931.description:
Promotional board game, published by the British roadside assistance company, Green Flag.

Box says it "Contains the Official Theory Test Questions."
It should prepare the learner driver - Assist the young cyclist - and refreshes the experienced driver.

Approved by the Department of Transport, the questions are mainly from the government's Learner Driver's Official Theory Test.

The object is to be the first player to reach the National Car Park barrier. Movement is with a dice and the game has car playing pieces. Answer various questions as you travel round the board. Watch out for penalty cards and direction arrows.

Contents
1 Game Board.
6 Car Playing Pieces.
3 Packs of Cards.
1 Die and Shaker.
1 Set of Rules.

115932.name: Adventure 2: Politico
videogameversion: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release
115932.description:
User Summary

Deep sea adventure consisting of 30 wrecks, 50 treasures and jelly fish, octopus and sharks all out to get you. Novelty for the game (specially advertised) was that is was a graphic adventure and it had the possibility to save your progress.

Game was part of a series of 4, all published by D.J. Moody and written by Greg Fox

115933.name: Adventure 3: The Satan Crystals
videogameversion: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release
115933.description:
User Summary

Land based adventure consisting of 50 locations, 70 treasures and ghosts, vampires, monsters, snakes and even Father Christmas and his Elves. Novelty for the game (specially advertised) was that is was a graphic adventure and it had the possibility to save your progress.

Game was part of a series of 4, all published by D.J. Moody and written by Greg Fox

115934.name: Adventure 4
videogameversion: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release
115934.description:
User Summary

Space adventure consisting of 30 stars and planets to visit, 70 treasures and Alien starships, pirates etc. Novelty for the game (specially advertised) was that is was a graphic adventure and it had the possibility to save your progress.

Game was part of a series of 4, all published by D.J. Moody and written by Greg Fox

115935.name: African Trail Simulator
videogameversion: Spanish ZX Spectrum tape cassette release
115935.description:
User Summary

Side scrolling off track racing game where the player traverses the African terrain in a time race.

115936.name: Electric Derby
115936.description:
A game of pure chance.

The game consists of a wheel with six horses on it. The wheel can be made to spin, causing the horses to go past the Winning Post each circuit of the spin.

Players bet on which horse will be last to go past the Winning Post. That horse will be numbered and that number light comes on at the side of the board.

The onjective is to have the most tokens that you used to bet with (you might even try to bet with real money).

115937.name: Aftermath
videogameversion: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release
115937.description:
Box description

The year is 2012 and tensions between the two superpoers are at their highest.

As Regional Air Defence Co-ordinator it is your duty to protect military bases in your area.

Each base consists of six domed billets and an Anti Missile complex. It is from here that you launch your anti missile missiles.

The attack is on.

You must destroy all incoming enemy missiles, aircraft and smart bombs before they reach ground zero, but fire carefully as you have a limited number of A.B.M.s. Should a missile or smart bomb hit either a billet or control centre, it will be destroyed. Control centres are repaired after each attack wave, but billets are unrepairable.

However, one billet is repaired once you have scored 10,000 points. Once all billets have been destroyed, the game will end.

Will you be able to cope with the Aftermath of it all?

115938.name: The End of a Legend!
115938.description:
The End of a legend! is an Enforcers adventure for 6-8 characters with 25-40 TCP's.

The all-known Superhero is dead, he was killed by terrorist and the players have to find out what was happen really.

(user summary)

115939.name: The Knights of Beverly Hills
115939.description:
The Nights of Beverly Hills is an Enforcers adventure for 4-7 characters with 40 TCP's.

This a modul to create an adventure about a security service in Beverly Hills.

(user summary)

115940.name: Marathom I: Gestrandet im Sog der Zeit
115940.description:
user summary

This is a german fantasy universal adventure for all "known Rolelayingsystems" (tested with D&D, AD&D, DSA, MERS and Palladium).

The adventure was designed for 4-6 characters.

The adventures takes the player through the time of one dessert city to search for an old artifact.

115942.name: Envoyer (Issue 50 - Dec 2000)
rpgissuearticle: News - ADRV und Envoyer auf der Messe
Stylo's Haßecke - Ich fühl mich wie 50
115942.description: This is the 50. issue of the german RPG magazine. Including a huge adventure for TRI.

115943.name: Afteroids
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
115943.description:
User Summary

Player steers a small space ship over the surface of a planet, shooting stuff. View is from right above, centred on the ship and moving with it.

115944.name: another damn Civilization game
115944.description:
4th game of the spielbox Wallace Edition.
Once more, dice determine the available player actions. 3 dice are thrown, the players get rerolls for abilities or money and tokens are placed in the corresponding boxes. These are emptied beginning with the #1 box up to #6. Every token allows for an action. Either taking resources (black piece or new token for a player), placing a token on the civilization track or moving a token on the track.
The civilization track has 30 space, it starts with reading / writing through different developments. Once a player places a token in the 30th space the round gets finished and victory points get tallied. Points are received from the track, per 3 black tokens, coins or playing pieces.
A player can have up to his maximum of 26 tokens on the track. Once a token is on the track, a new token can be placed adjacent to it. Different spaces give different abilities to the players, like re-rolls, victory points or resources. Some spaces have a cost to use them, like War, which allows the removal of a token from another player.

115945.name: Swords Against Shaligon!
115945.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mysterious assault at sea...

A capricious goddess awakens on a remote isle...

A land in need of heroes...

Now is the time to take up arms, and fight the evil that awakens...

Now is the time to raise swords against Shaligon!

For First Level Heroes!

This introductory adventure is written for use with the 4th edition of the world's greatest fantasy role playing game and is set in the fabled Realms of Chirak, also available from Zodiac Gods Publishing. You can use this module as a new tale for first level adventurers in any background with minimal effort.

Note: An earlier version of this module appeared initially in The Sorcerer's Scrolls (Issue 42). This version has some changes and improved maps.

115947.name: Ins Frankenland hinein
115947.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 88)
learn more about Franconia
- moving by turns/simple 'Roll and Move' game -

each player buys in getting an equal amount of (numbered sightseeing) city cards (18 in total);
(pewter) meeples are moved according the die roll;
ending on a space possessing a card of it should be flipped, read and can be used as a joker, if later player ends on a marked space (see rules) with bad news...
remark: game belongs to the series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele" with very nice graphics/images
game was published early 1930's

115948.name: Strands of Power
115948.description:
From publisher blurb:

STRANDS OF POWER is the key that will unlock the true potential of your favorite STRANDS OF FATE characters. With this supplement, you've got all the tools to create the ultimate characters for any campaign.

Strands of Power compiles and updates the Advantages available to your characters, as well as offers a host of new Expert, Heroic and Power Advantages. In addition, existing Powers get dozens of new Modifiers, and new Meta-Powers can even change the way you purchase Powers.

Strands of Power greatly expands the Strands of Fate game system, featuring:

Compiled and updated Advantages from Strands of Fate.
Dozens of new Advantages, Modifiers and Meta-Powers
Power Packages: Sets of Aspects, Ability Adjustments and Advantages that allow you to create characters around a theme. Packages include: Armored Hero, Barbarian, Bard, Cleric, Dragon, Knight, Lycanthrope, Monk, Paragon, Psychic, Savant, Sorcerer, Super Soldier, Thief, Vampire, Vigilante Hero, Warlock and Wizard
Power Sources: Detailed explorations of a number of Power Sources, advice for purchasing Powers to match their Power Source. Power Sources include: Arcane Magic, Cybernetic Augmentations, Dark Gifts, Divine Magic, Psychic Talent, & Tech Savant Programs
Power Applications: Dozens of Powers, pre-defined with Modifiers and Meta-Powers, created to simulate spells, psychic talents, cybernetic augmentations, etc. These both save time during character creation, and serve as inspiration for your creations.
Companions: Turn the tides of destiny in your favor with NPC companions loyal to your cause. Gain a wise mentor, a loyal love interest, a brave sidekick, or a legion of minions armed to the teeth.

115949.name: Airbase Invader
videogameversion: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release
115949.description:
User Summary

In this game, you're a female CND supporter (Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament) waving a protest flag and infiltration in an airbase bunker, where you try to stop president Raygun from pressing the red button and starting a nuclear war. You're hindered by policemen, soldiers and even an indestructible Maggie Thatchers.
You can neutralize opponents by kissing them. Still, catching the president ain't easy, as he tends to clone himself, besides being pretty fast.

115950.name: Barbie Horse Adventures: Wild Horse Rescue
115950.description:
Barbie Horse Adventures: Wild Horse Rescue is a video game based on the Barbie line of dolls by Mattel.

A storm comes in and causes the gate at a ranch to open, letting horses and foals run away. Barbie must track down the foals and horses through 3 parts of 3 different settings: the forest, the mountains, and the beach. There is an average of three foals plus one horse that can be found at the end of the section. In the 2nd part of the section, a missing horse will be found by someone else, and Barbie must race them.

A sequel to Wild Horse Rescue was released on October 26, 2008. It was titled "Barbie Horse Adventures: Riding Camp".

Source: Wikipedia, "Barbie Horse Adventures: Wild Horse Rescue", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115951.name: Battle Stadium D.O.N
115951.description:
Battle Stadium D.O.N (バトルスタジアムＤＯＮ) is a Japanese fighting game featuring characters from the three popular manga series published by Weekly Shōnen Jump: Dragon Ball Z, One Piece, and Naruto -- D.O.N.

Similar to the Super Smash Bros. series, the players are put onto either a moving or non-moving stage. Like Power Stone, these stages have some level of interactivity. Players must then fight their opponents. Unlike other fighters, D.O.N uses a combined health gauge, that is, decreasing the health of one player will in turn increase the health of the other players. Thus, in order for one player to win a fight, they must make their own health bar take up the entire bar. As such, a fight can potentially last indefinitely if no time limit is set. Also, there are in-game techniques that can be pulled off (i.e. Kamehameha for Goku and Summoning Jutsu for Naruto) and supers that can transform the characters into a new form (i.e. Naruto's Rasengan turning him into the Kyuubi and Goku's Genki Dama turning him into Super Saiyan). In addition, some characters can induce a temporary transformation during the battle (i.e. Sasuke's Sharingan and Luffy's Gear 2nd).

The single player mode has the player fight through five rounds, 2 or 3 of which have missions with goals selected randomly. However, depending on the difficulty chosen by the player, different amounts of missions are given out with easy giving the least and very difficult giving out the most. Fulfilling the missions' goals rewards the player with coins that can be used in the slot machine available upon completing the fights. The slot machine is the way through which unlockables are obtained.

Up to four players can participate in a multiplayer session, though a multitap must be used for more than two players for the PS2 version.

Source: Wikipedia, "Battle Stadium D.O.N", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115952.name: BCV: Battle Construction Vehicles
115952.description:
BCV: Battle Construction Vehicles, known in Japan as Kensetsu Juuki Kenka Battle: Buchigire Kongou!, is one of the first PlayStation 2 titles to be released in DVD-ROM format, rather than CD-ROM as most early PS2 titles were.

This is an odd fighting game, where you must battle in various construction vehicles, like a high-hoe or a front-end loader. The plot is that a rival construction company is competing to take over your father's company and you must compete to save the day.

The game was only released in Europe and Japan.

Source: Wikipedia, "BCV: Battle Construction Vehicles", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115953.name: Beat Down: Fists of Vengeance
115953.description:
Beat Down: Fists of Vengeance is a 3rd person action/fighting video game in which the player takes the role of any of 5 gangsters, running from their boss. The player earns respect on the street by fighting enemies to take down a shadowy organization and become the city's ultimate fighter.

There are numerous moves that the player can use to beat their enemies including hand to hand combat, melee weapon comabat and in the later stages of the game firearms such as pistols and shotguns. Super powerful combination moves are available in certain situations. During the course of the game players can buy clothes and plastic surgery to escape the police. All clothes are available to the player meaning you can dress a male character as female and a female character as male.

In Both Vs modes you can watch battles, fight a CPU, and fight against a friend. The difference between Vs mode normal and custom mode is in custom mode you can chose between the characters you have recruited in your gang. In vs mode normal its only the main characters. You can a have a max of 3 characters to both teams.

Source: Wikipedia, "Beat Down: Fists of Vengeance", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115954.name: Air Defence
videogameversion: UK ZX SPectrum tape cassette release
115954.description:
Cassette inlay
Play the role of Commander of Air Defences in AIR DEFENCE. You have 10 squadrons of Fighters, 2 squadrons of Early Warning Aircraft (AEW) and 2 squadrons of Flight Refueling Tanker Aircraft (AAR). Your objective is to fend off and destroy the waves of enemy aircraft that are trying to destroyy your industries, radar, ships, airfields and your Headquarters. Beware of the enemy squadrons that have heavy fighter escorts! There are 5 levels of difficulty.

User Summary
Game apparently show some part of the British East coast. Game is real time, so the player must punch in all commands as fast as he can. Airfields must be preserved for your squadrons to land and take off, industries for rearming, HQ for communications and radars to prevent you from fighting blindfolded.

115955.name: beatmania
115955.description:
The game beatmania is also known colloquially as BMUS (for beatmania (US)) to distinguish it from the original arcade game beatmania. This is the first version of the music video game beatmania IIDX to be released in the United States.

The game uses the engine from the console version of Beatmania IIDX 9th Style, and was originally demonstrated with its original cyan and white UI, but the final release uses a reskinned version of it recolored purple. The judgement also has changed from the Japanese version, with the flashing "Great!" judgement being shown in the North American version as "Perfect", much like in Dance Dance Revolution (recent versions of IIDX in Japan have referred to them as "perfect greats" in their "judge mode" display). The grading system in this game is also significantly easier than the Japanese games, requiring much lower scores to attain the highest grades.

Another change from the Japanese version of the game is the included controller has been modified slightly from the original Japanese version. The two controllers are similar in appearance. However, whereas the Japanese controller has a rectangular shape, the American controller features a rounded edge on the side where the turntable sits, and generally has a slightly lower profile. The keys on the American controller are also springloaded, whereas the Japanese controller's keys are not. This is presumably to prevent sticking, which is a common problem on the Japanese controller. Most players, American or Japanese, felt that the new American controller was a welcomed improvement, making the American controller the preferred choice.

The regular beatmania and beatmania IIDX modes correspond to their regular counterparts, and both feature songs and gameplay mechanics from their respective series integrated into the 9th Style engine (such as 5/10 and 7/14 keys, and the return of free scratch zones in 5-key mode). In contrast, recent IIDX games in Japan have had a 5-key mode selectable in an options menu on the song selection menu.

There are 58 tracks in this game (not counting the fact that 20, November is "single mix" on Single and "radio edit" on Double). All tracks are playable in Game Mode, and then in Free Mode after being played once in Game Mode. While there are no hidden songs, only a few are available when starting the game. More appear as the game progresses, but once the game is started again only those same few are available.

Because the Beatmania controller uses the standard PS2 controller connection, it was not originally compatible with the PlayStation 3.
